Reviews.Title: “top hotel”
Reviews.Author: steve c
Reviews.Content: The Wellington Hotel is a 5 star class hotel. Close to Retiro Park, fountains, lakes, gardens, great for runners. High standards of service in hotel, nothing to much trouble for staff to assist you. Our second stay at the hotel and it has a great ambience. Only draw back is the pool is virtually in the shade, if you take a seat up by the pool grab a couple of the nice chairs nearest the restaurant and you will have sun for most of the day. watch out for the air conditioning which gets sprayed out of the umbrellas. gym excellent what you would expect for this standard of hotel, top of the range equipment. skip the pricey breakfast at hotel, good coffee shop cafe chocala opposite the main gate to retiro park, left out of hotel and then right on main road, few minutes walk. cannot wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “FIRST CLASS”
Reviews.Author: fourbars
Reviews.Content: What can one add to 5 stars. The Wellington is a first class classic traditional hotel. Perfect service. Attentive and friendly but not effusive- professional. a pleasure stay with them. Rooms are slightly dated (Classical) but perfect. very comfortable beds with luxurious linen.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: wedderburner
Reviews.Content: The Wellington hotel is situated close to the Retiro park and within walking distance of Prado Excellent service. Room a bit dated but balcony gave evening sun and great views of Madrid Breakfast buffet as others say first class and internal terrace and pool a haven. We would return and would rate five star if room remodelled

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel for city break”
Reviews.Author: Geesje E
Reviews.Content: Great hotel on perfect location. Staff very friendly and rooms big and comfortable. The swimming pool plus rooftop terrace are a bonus in summer. Close to metro, Retiro park and the top class shops & restaurants in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Could have just been the room”
Reviews.Author: KJS123
Reviews.Content: The staff was very helpful and friendly but our room seemed very dated, including the mattress. Located in a nice, quiet neighborhood. Probably wouldn't return to the same hotel, but didn't have a terrible experience.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, best feature is the outdoor area and comfy beds!”
Reviews.Author: claire2767
Reviews.Content: This hotel is rather grand as you would expect from a 5 star one. Our room (we paid a bit more for superior) was lovely with a huge bathroom but it was a bit tight space wise after they put up a camp bed for our son. The beds were so comfy!!! We chose this hotel purely for the swimming pool and in doing so paid more. The pool area was nice but rather small with too few sun beds, if you arrive in the afternoon you won't get a space. As other people point out the pool loses the sun late afternoon which is probably why it is rather cold. Although this hotel is close to retiro park we felt it was a bit far away certainly from the old town and did not find good inexpensive places to eat in the vicinity so ended up getting the metro to Sol or Opera in the evening. We opted not to pay the extra 19 euro each for breakfast so cannot comment on that. The hotel bar was extortionate, having stayed at another hotel in Madrid at the start of our trip and just eating and drinking generally in the city we know it wasn't good value, but that's 5 star hotels for you I suppose. If we returned to Madrid we probably would not stay here again, despite the pool/ outdoor area, as there are better hotels which offer better value for money in a better localtion.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Cayetana
Reviews.Content: Very good location, on the Retiro district, near Metro Station and nice neighborhood. Elegant, clean, good bed, not superb. Hotel and rooms have been remodeled on an old building so some details are still old fashioned. The breakfast buffet is a must! Will definitely return!

Reviews.Title: “Glory days are gone...”
Reviews.Author: BenzBoy007
Reviews.Content: Was booked into this hotel as part of a tour package. You can tell that 20 years ago, this hotel was a gem in Madrid-true 5 star excellence. The common areas are beautiful, the front desk staff very helpful and the breakfast buffet very grand. But it's physical plant is slipping. The room was ok-very nice size for the price. The antique furniture in the room slightly banged up. But the oddest things jump out at you-the towels were thin and worn, a couple had holes! Ironing board brought to the room was broken- small things, but the difference between a 5 star and everyone else.

Reviews.Title: “Sheer elegance!”
Reviews.Author: WiltshireTraveller66
Reviews.Content: This hotel is discreet and refined. It oozes elegance. The main benefit is the (tiny) pool out on the terrace and ....the superb thermal spa. I got a deal on Travelzoo for half price "thermal circuit" - little did I realise that the water is actually sea water or water with added sea minerals. I was not told this by the rather haughty and unpleasant receptionists (in the spa), nor was it explained that there were many buttons to press to activate the various jets! However, I felt the effects of the pool for days afterwards (I did smell of seaweed for the rest of the day despite numerous showers!). A lovely elegant hotel with wonderfully comfortable beds and discrete service ......highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Elegant hotel”
Reviews.Author: ASN1972
Reviews.Content: This was a very beautiful and formal hotel in the heart of Madrid. The lobby is exquisite and elegant. Our bedroom had a king sized bed that was always perfectly made up every day. I was so impressed. I have never seen such bedsheets. It's as if the maid had pressed and starched the sheets. I have stayed at a lot of hotels in 15 years of my travels, and never seen such an immaculately made bed. I loved this elegant hotel, but I am not fond of Madrid. There's basically nothing to do, but really waste your money on eating at overpriced restaurants, shopping at El Cortes Ingles and boutiques, and going to museums. Not likely to ever travel to Spain for the rest of my life. Both Barcelona and Madrid did not do it for me.

Reviews.Title: “Spanish Tradition, after many years I've return....still that good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Taavi H
Reviews.Content: After many years I returned to the Wellington and is that good hotel that I remember. Very comfortable, excellent service and good quality. It was called before the Hotel for the Matador and has given an special charming memory for me. In Finland we are not used to the bull fights but here is not the same. Location, you are just in the best area of Madrid with the good restaurants a few minutes. This is one of may favorites hotels and I'll hope to return many times.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel nice location”
Reviews.Author: Abasmaih
Reviews.Content: We stayed twice in this hotel. Both times we were satisfied. However, during our second stay we were bothered by the loud music from a nightclub next door! Breakfast was less the average. Location is great. Good overall hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Just average”
Reviews.Author: kc_traveller99
Reviews.Content: Like others who have reviewed, this five star hotel is really just an OK four star. We stayed 6 nights. Some points worth noting: - Room service was efficient. - Location is near Metro and the Retiro Park if that is your thing. It's not central ( Plaza Mayor ..etc ). But close to the 3 big museums/art galleries. - The area has some good restaurants, e.g. Oven 180. - Nice to have a hotel with a pool to cool down after a long day, pool isn't big. We compared this with Emperador Hotel, which is central and has a large pool. - Most of the staff were indifferent / glum. - Hotel decor looks old fashioned and outdated. We booked a Superior Double, which supposedly are upgraded to a modern style compared to the standard rooms. But sadly most of the changes are cosmetic. The corridors reminds me of scenes from Addams family. - The double bed we had were way too small, we're not big people. So we had to change to a twin room. The rooms themselves are pretty small. - There's a mini carrefour supermarket 15 minutes walk away on Calle de Castelló.

Reviews.Title: “3 days in madrid”
Reviews.Author: teflon1956
Reviews.Content: Hotel has good central position for sightseeing, tour bus stops outside and 5 min walk to main park or shopping area. Prado and other galleries/museums not too far either. The reception is slow and impersonal but the hotel and facilities are lovely. Pool is nice but loses the sun late afternoon and area becomes cold and we found the service inthe outside restaurant slow and disjointed although when being served it was nice and friendly service. Our room was excellent with a large bathroom. Great breakfast. Nice roomy lounges and bar area which have an old fashioned period feel.

Reviews.Title: “Noizy”
Reviews.Author: Casperinho
Reviews.Content: More service expected from a 5 star hotel. Got a whole night of subwoofer noise of the discotheque club in the same building. When complaining, staff didn't seem to care.. Pool area and gym are pretty ok!

Reviews.Title: “Matador Magic”
Reviews.Author: MadMonkofMaidaVale
Reviews.Content: The Wellington is one of those old, school European Hotels with concierges who have a fair few stories to tell; shiny brass and polished marble everywhere without a hint of pseudo post modernism and real sense of a place where original and unique human narratives flow. One feels a little like you have been teleported into a different age of glamour, serious business, cigarettes and whisky. It has had a little gym, pool, terrace and spa added, which although aesthetically a little out of kilter with the rest of place, ensures one can refresh in the modern way after or before a hard days work. I love it here, a little faded but a beautiful authentic place with a gorgeous park on the doorstep, Only complaints dodgy music in terrace bar and in the week maybe a global corporate business bod too many (I suppose that'll be be then)

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable!”
Reviews.Author: LelaBrazil
Reviews.Content: I was there for two diferents times, it's beautiful, very comfortabel, the staff is really kind and helpful, the breakfast is fantastic! This is my favorite hotel in Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel in style and top location”
Reviews.Author: Roger B
Reviews.Content: We booked the hotel on a recommendation by a local business partner. Our stay was a mix of business and recreation. We did ask for a "quiet room, non smoking". Upon checking in, everything looked perfect, although we were on a smoking floor. But the room was nice and very spacious. The first night we had a lot of noise around 4-6am as our room was obvioulsy very close to the employees wardrobe or some other service room. The next day we asked for a more quiet room and this was no problem. The new room was a bit smaller, higher floor, but smoking room again. Anyway, the initial smoking smell we covered quickly with our own (my wife's nice perfume) and the following two nights we slept without problem. The internet service is a bit old fashioned. We had the internet included in our package, but we had to ask for a new access and re-enter the code every 24 hours. And it allowed only one work-station to be active simultaneously... That was a little disturbing.... The pool-area is located in an inner court-yard with a very nice pool-restaurant. Food is good and a pleasant location for evening drinks. The fitness centre is well equiped, clean and spacious. The staff at the recpetion and room-cleaning are all very friendly and helpful. In the pool-restaurant we experienced everything, from top friendly to a rather arrogant and ignorant treatment by probably the most beautiful girl in Madrid (at least she was convinced she is, but she is still very young and will sure learn her lessons....). The area around the hotel offers many nice restaurants. The city tour bus stops right in front of the hotel. Overall we liked the hotel a lot ! And our first stay in beautiful Madrid (!) was a very good one.

Reviews.Title: “Third visit, better than ever.”
Reviews.Author: Liilak
Reviews.Content: I once stayed here last January and I was pleasantly surprised. As you know, even if the hotel has several strong points I had previously pointed out how rooms looked dated and needed some mild, albeit urgent, refurbishment. Well, we were lucky enough to be appointed a room that had indeed been renovated, and it looked remarkable. Not to mention it was a 7th-floor (I think) room with a balcony and stunning views over Madrid. Breakfast was as wonderful as ever, by the way. So I encourage those in charge to keep renovating the rooms in order to meet with the top standards this hotel proudly advertises.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury- frayed around the edges”
Reviews.Author: kkthepeach
Reviews.Content: This was a very nice hotel, and I cannot fault the service. But the years are really starting to show. The carpet and walls and bathroom are very worn. A refurb is needed. Wonderful fresh flowers in the lobby and main lobby of each floor. great service, nice cafe, wonderful pool. Location was quiet- but not ideal for sightseers. I don't have specific complaints, but would not recommend it to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful downtown location, and a pool!”
Reviews.Author: Daryl K
Reviews.Content: We moved to the Wellington after 3 nights in a different hotel. Good move! The hotel is a gracious old-style establishment, staff is courteous and efficient. The beds are comfortable; linens nice and a huge deep tub with lots of hot water. Can walk to Prado, Retiro, Serrano, etc. It got hot here, and the pool is what sold us on it. Great outdoor space with an adjacent outdoor restaurant and bar. Buffet lunch was delicious, drinks generous. Right next door is a cafe where we enjoyed a great dinner (vegetable soup and poached fish). And the spa offers full service: including a CrossFit trainer (if you are a "real" CrossFitter, you won't find all the equipment you are used to).

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, but decor a bit dated”
Reviews.Author: Neil G
Reviews.Content: Great hotel - had a very nice stay for a corporate event. Food is nice, outside terrace is great, conferencing rooms are comfortable. Decor in the rooms is a bit dated, an could so with being refreshed.

Reviews.Title: “Wellington facility, staff, and location is 5 star”
Reviews.Author: Bajatoro
Reviews.Content: We came with a University tour of 29 folks. Rooms were ready and spacious, clean with a view. Wifi free but you have to get a new password every day. Thats a little negative, but, not a biggie. Shower and bath had instant hot water. Retiro Park one block away. So all major sites for first-second timers walkable. Breakfast included at 7 in beautiful area with highly attentive staff. Desk friendly and accomodating even though tour admin messed up a three day extend stay over Memorial weekend with added problem of National Soccer playoff which filled hotel and tour contact was not available by email. Point for future ref: If you do extend with pro tour, especially one that says it specializes in Alumni tour, triple check extensions. Double check every thing else. No names here. We HIGHLY recommend this hotel and will return.

Reviews.Title: “big rooms, excellent service”
Reviews.Author: Eugenio G
Reviews.Content: indeed a bit old fashioned, but located in a great place in Madrid. Next to Retiro park, great for jogging. Best shops in town around the corner, the same for restaurants. But if you are tired and just want room service, you will be surprised by high quality products and very decent wines at "normal prices".

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great room, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Auroraam
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed the Wellington Hotel. Our room was terrific and comfortable as was the bath. The staff were helpful and friendly. The breakfasts were excellent, and I loved the coffee! The location was great.

Reviews.Title: “excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Maria263
Reviews.Content: When you enter a 5-star luxury hotel, you expect the best. So Wellington doesn't keep the promise in full. Some things are good, some are very poor.Of course the hotel is beautiful and conveniently located (minutes away from the Retire Park) in downtown Madrid. But that's it. The room was not so spacious (and it's ok considering it's an old building) but the amenities are so and so. The next time I will go to Madrid I will choose another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Grand Hotel”
Reviews.Author: KT34
Reviews.Content: Victorian era Grand Hotel. Some rooms a bit shabby but others have been redecorated and are much better for it. Good location, good breakfast. Nice lobby, foyer area. Have stayed several times for business and pleasure. Minibar ridiculously over priced though.

Reviews.Title: “Staying at the Wellington in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: HedonistSpeaks
Reviews.Content: The Hedonist speaks.    The Wellington is a grand old building that feels very upscale and comfortable. The staff are all terrific, helpful, friendly and efficient. The rooms are well appointed and comfortable.  Breakfast (22€) with no a la cart available, is held in a dedicated room and the buffet is huge and a perfect way to start the day, with the following caveat: if you love coffee, get it somewhere else. It seems to me that a hotel that is this expensive could find a good coffee machine. Wait! Go to the "Llaves de Oro" cafeteria on the property. Good coffee by Spanish standards, but no food beyond rolls (many varieties) or maybe an edible but not exciting sandwich.  They open at 8:00.  BTW... It's  a cafeteria in name only... Just a limited menu restaurant. Don't eat there except in an extreme calorie emergency.  For foodies, there is an amazing restaurant on the property... Goizeka. It is, sorry to say, trés expensif... Errr... "muy caro", but happy to say trés amazing.... Errr... "Fabuloso." Worth every penny. The wine list is mostly Spanish wines and about a hundred pages long. (Spanish wines are seriously underrated. Delicious. The Rioja wines are the most famous, but also try the Riberas.) The wait staff is there the second before you know you need them and the food is brilliant. Americans should go early (8:00 is early) as much to get acclimated to the late dinner times as to see the parade of beautiful people coming in. Our meal lasted 'til almost 11:00. We were the first to leave.  Families with children showed up as late as 9:30. No kids? Even later. It was our lot to be among the earliest to eat every night... Frankly, I don't know how they do it, but they all seem to take it in stride. It's "normal." Yes, there are some flaws at the Wellington so lets get to them.  1. I don't like starched sheets. They are lovely but just not to my liking. I've never had a desire to sleep on sandpaper. Hey... I'm a hedonist. 2. The pillows are way too big and overstuffed... Again, beautiful to look at, but not comfortable. Take your own. (As a dedicated hedonist, I always do, just in case.) 3. I'm an early riser so I had to walk two blocks to "Cafe y Te" for my morning coffee, which was actually a good thing because I got to see the locals on their way to (or from) work, and listen in on their conversations. (It was probably the best coffee of the trip.) It was fun watching the young office workers having coffee and pastries as well as the late shift people having beer and pizza on their way home after a long night - all there at the same time.  4. We have to renew our wifi passwords every 24 hours. Really? What a waste. Also, their wifi provider is "kube" and the signal was often weak, and would almost as often just quit and we would have to get new passwords. Worst of all is that my wife and I each have an iPhone and an iPad and we were allowed only one device on the system at a time per room. Time to upgrade your system, Wellington! This ain't the Holiday Inn. 5. We wanted to buy a bottle of water in the library area (after several glasses of wine) to take to our room and were told we had to get it from room service. Huh? Get a grip Wellington. To be fair, we managed to do it the next evening, but that night I walked a hundred yards to "Llaves." 6. There is a large, clear glass door between the bath and toilet areas of the bathrooms. Nice idea in a way and very pretty, but at 3:00 in the morning, it can be a hazard to navigate in limited light. I know this from personal experience. 7. Speaking of bathrooms, the faucets for the sink are directed a bit forward which means that - since the sinks are a bit small - you have to be careful not to turn it on all the way unless you actually enjoy getting your legs wet. (Maybe a thrill for some, I don't know. ) 8. We stayed at the Wellington for a week. They left us the same bathroom glasses every day. Huh? Despite all of the above,  the Wellington is a nice, if imperfect place to stay. There are lots of places to eat that are walking distance from the Wellington.   "El Alkalde" is very expensive, but worth trying for the foodies in the house. I'm not sure why our lunch for three was 130€, but it was excellent. I highly recommend the "El Colonial de Goya". The food was delicious, the wait staff and manager very friendly and helpful, and it was almost embarrassingly inexpensive. (Dinner for three with too much (delicious) food was 80€, including wine.) There are at least five other places within walking distance that looked interesting, but we just didn't have time.   A tip about tipping in Spain.  Unlike the US (or most other countries,) there is nowhere on a charge slip to add a tip. Apparently tipping is a new concept here.  So... Take some small tipping cash and leave it on the change tray. Supposedly a 15% service charge is already included by law, but tips are VERY much appreciated. You're a rich person ( by most standards, even if not your own) and a small bit of generosity might make a big difference to someone else.

Reviews.Title: “Location:Price:Incredible Vacation”
Reviews.Author: acuna1132
Reviews.Content: Beginning with it's amazing friendly staff, the Wellington is a one of the kind hotels in the heart of Madrid. Located just minutes from El Retiro, you are able to walk to shops and restaurants to find great deals and enjoy exquisite meals!!!! Highly recommended!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great old fashion **** hotel in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: EZParis
Reviews.Content: The Wellington is apparently knowed as the toreadors hotel. I just loved my stay. The room are not the nicest nor the most modern but there is an ancient charme to the entire hotel. Bathrooms are very 70's but are super clean. Then you can access to the pool area that is quite modern and a real plus in the heart of Madrid! The poolside restaurant is very cool and the buffet menu is very good. The staff is very nice and helpful. Breakfast in the room is really great and also kinda old fashion. All in all, I really enjoyed my stay at the Wellington and I am looking forward to staying there!

Reviews.Title: “Charming”
Reviews.Author: sandra q
Reviews.Content: The Wellington local life. The elders of the area go for cocktails and get together there. Also, the terrace outside with a local shoe shinner is a must. Breakfast at the cafeteria is great. What I find most rewarding is the staff at the front desk. Courteous, well informed and always willing to help. Most of them have been there for many years so you keep seeing the same faces. The porter is a charm. Good restaurant in the hotel and in the area. I would not think of going to another hotel in Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Wellington, Madrid”
Reviews.Author: lyd678
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from my 5th visit to The Hotel Wellington in Madrid. I stayed for 2 nights and once again could not find fault with this Hotel at all. I stayed in room 306 which overlooked the pool area and it was peaceful & very quiet at this time of year. (not sure what it would be like in July & August?) Room service is very fast and placing an order is easy as English is spoken with all members of staff. The breakfast is excellent and the chef is always "on hand" if you wish for him to cook eggs of your choice for you. The desk & waiting staff are always attentive and although this is a "classy" Hotel, there is always a very laid back feel about it. I visit Madrid often and would not consider staying anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at Hotel Wellington”
Reviews.Author: dany
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this very pleasant hotel at the end of January, Beautiful room, lovely breakfast, turn down, all wonderful. The only little thing was that in order to access the Spa and the inner pool you need to book a treatment. Besides that, great location, close to beautiful Parque del Retiro, at walking distance to all the major sights. They also gave us an IPod for free (only for one day).

Reviews.Title: “super”
Reviews.Author: ITA_And_RE_a
Reviews.Content: The hotel was lovely - clean, comfortable and quiet. The hotel is conveniently located to the park and subway that will get you anywhere you need to be. I would definitely stay there again upon a return visit!! Loved the double-door entry for extra quietness.

Reviews.Title: “Grand old lady”
Reviews.Author: Pascal C
Reviews.Content: This is a true grand old lady. I stayed there with my wife for a 4 night city break. We were looking for a comfortable, central hotel and found the Wellington. No disappointment at all. Sure, the hotel could do with an update ... but it's just fine as well as it is. Very clean, good amenities, everything functional and as far as we are concerned: good service. Additional bonus: the red tourist bus stops in front of the hotel, the upmarket shopping area and a few good restaurants can be reached easily on foot. We did not eat there other than breakfast, which was absolutely adequate. I definitely recommend and would return.

Reviews.Title: “Grand hotel which now needs an upgrade”
Reviews.Author: Eddie B
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with friends last year whilst in Madrid for the night. I usually stay at the Adler which is top notch, but we just needed something simple for the night and the Wellington did us a good deal. The hotel was certainly very grand in it's day. The building is still quite impressive and very well situated. The rooms are very large indeed and well furnished although a little dated now and could probably do with some upgrading. All in all though, not a bad hotel and very good value for the money for what you get and where you are.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely old hotel in the centre of town”
Reviews.Author: leparis5
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Wellington for a week in order to explored Madrid. the Hop On Red Bus stops at the door of the hotel. I took a two day ticket and spent the first day sight seeing and the second day I used it as a means of public transport. I also took a walking tour of the old city and I was then ready to use the subway system. The hotel is more than comfortable and has a splendid breakfast. The only drawback was the cost of the internet in the room. There was a business centre where one could access the internet. The staff were attentive and very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Classic, good location, service to be improved”
Reviews.Author: Ludovica40
Reviews.Content: GENERAL IMPRESSION: The hotel is quite classic, impressive, comfortable. A 5 star hotel had it not been for some service faults, especially with the final bill: had we not checked carefully we would have paid 100 euros that weren't due! Got no aplogies for that either. We found a very good package offer which included breakfast and spa. LOCATION: located in an elegant part of town, full of high class shops and beautiful buildings. It's quiet and very close to the underground that will easily take you anywhere. The Prado Museum is at a 10 minutes walk and the Retiro Park is even closer. It's not right in the city center though. ROOM: We had a superior room, recently renovated, very charming and perfectly comfortable. No noise came from the street (quiet and with triple glass windows). But one night we heard some annoying music coming from upstairs, so the room is not totally sound proof. FOOD: Breakfast was quite good as far as quality of food, coffee and service is concerned (scrambled eggs, sausages, salmon, ham, cheese, toasts). May be there could be a vaster variety of food to choose from Room service was a mess: we chose to have brunch in the room and although the order was for two, they only came with one glass and cuttlery for one. The omelette was the worse ever tasted: no taste at all. The hotel also has a very good restaurant. Dinner there is not cheap (150 euros for two) but the food was very good, the atmosphere and the service were not too formal but attentive. Careful to allergies too. The café serves light lunches: service there is careless. We ordered sparkling water and they brought it still, I specified three times that I am celiac and must not have bread with the ham I ordered, needless to say they arrived with a dish of ham covered by bread. Worse of all the waiter said he would pull it off! I had to follow him and make sure he'd prepare a new plate without contamination of bread (which could kill a celiac, so it's no joke). SPA: small but pleasent. The girl at the reception is very kind and willing to help. They provided a bathing suite since I had forgotten mine hairdresser, not too kind but the outcome was professional. SERVICE: just about sufficient but not as kind and efficient as one would expect in a 5 star hotel. This would only be a minor nuisance had it not been for two facts: I tried to hire an Ipad for one day. It took endless tries to get it working (first they said they would send it to my room, then they called back saying I had to go downstairs to sign the contract, then I went willing to pay cash but it was impossible, they wanted a credit card-although I had left one for their garantee, when they finally gave me the Ipad, I found out it wasn't working. I called back and they said they had forgotten to give me the access code, couldn't do it by phone, had to go back. I go back and they can't work out how to make it work. I get annoyed so they suggest they'd work on it and then call me back. In the end they apologized and made up for the nuisance letting me use it a second day for free). But what bothered me the most was the bill at the end of the stay: they charged us 100 euros for breakfast and another couple of things that were not due. I told them that breakfast was included in our package and proved them the other costs were a mistake too. They took them off but without apologies nor explanations of their mistake, which left us with an uncomfortable feeling and some doubts. All in all it is a good standard hotel, in a good area of Madrid. Just check the bill in the end, don't expect very high levels of kindness and efficiency from the staff.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Choice”
Reviews.Author: konstanzj
Reviews.Content: Hotel Wellingon staff was exceptional in their friendliness and attention to meeting the needs of their guests. The rooms were very nicely appointed, quiet, and clean. And, of equal importance, the beds and pillows were comfortable and covered with nice linens. The hotel is located about 2 blocks from the subway so access to mass transportation was easy. The hotel itself is located in a very nice neighborhood very near to the "Central Park" of Madrid, which, by the way if lovely to walk in. The hotel is also within walking distance of the Prado Museum (about 20 minutes on foot). I did a lot of walking around the city during our stay at the hotel and always felt safe even when I walked alone from the hotel to Plaza Mayor. We had delicious breakfasts at the hotel each morning which offered many choices. We also had a evening meal at the hotel which was the best meal I think I had in Spain. There is an adjoining restuarant to the hotel as well where we had great late afternoon foods. There is abssolutely nothing negative that I can think of to report about this property. Obviously, I'd recommend it during a Madrid stay.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: shoppermom
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just spent 6 nights in Madrid to celebrate our anniversary and had a wonderful experience staying at the Wellington. First of all, since they knew it was our anniversary, we were upgraded to a beautiful suite with a large balcony and wonderful view of the city. The room was extremely spacious, had a large king-size comfortable bed, great linens, and beautiful modern bathroom with all high end toiletries. The staff was always very helpful, courteous, and professional. They were also helpful in making dinner reservations, suggesting restaurants, recommending great places to shop and assist with any of our concerns. Breakfast was included in our rate and was always fresh with a nice variety of hot foods, breads and pastries, meats and cheeses, fresh fruit and cereals-also they served until 11 AM which was nice when we wanted to sleep a little later in the AM. Location is superb - easy walk to the Prado Museum, the best shops and restaurants, Retiro Park, and a nearby metro stop. We walked almost everywhere in the city since it is a perfect location- far enough away from the tourist area of Plaza Mayor but a pleasant walk to the central part of the city. Hotel Wellington made our Anniversary a very special occasion and I would highly recommend staying there if you want excellent service, a great location and good value in Madrid. Thank you to the wonderful staff of Hotel Wellington for making our anniversary a memorable experience!

Reviews.Title: “A Royal Experience ?”
Reviews.Author: William N
Reviews.Content: The Wellington in Madrid, according to pundits, should provide a "royal" experience. I guess that being in Madrid, Spain, it gets as "imperfect" as the Borbons (the spanish royal family) do. The building and its interiors its absolutely beautiful. The reading lunch adjacent to the lobby is elegant and comfortable. The bar is superb. As of 2010 it is the only bar in Madrid capable of presenting you with a perfect Martini (steered, never shaken). The breakfast buffet rather ordinary and expensive and KABUKI, the Japanese restaurant adjacent to the hotel is simply out of this world. If you love Japanese food you must visit. If, on the other hand, you just like sushi you will be disappointed for it is fancy and expensive. Consistent with its MICHELIN star rating. The we get to to the rooms. They are ample and elegant like the rest of the hotel building. Unfortunately, this an old building with lots of limitations and inconveniences which derive from a combination of age and poor maintenance. Our room was so hot during the first night that I simply couldn't sleep. We tried adjusting the temperature by operating the thermostat to no avail. Remember, this is a monarchy. Old and out of touch with the times. The rooms have a separate heating and AC system and the only way to lower the room temperature that night was to open the window. The next day we learned that there is an arcane heat control knob in the headboard of the bed. Too late to know it. The staff is prompt and attentive. They can speak several languages with ease. In summary, if you are a frequent visitor to Madrid, choose an especial, occasion and stay at the Wellington. It is very expensive for what they offer but provides a unique and elegant hospitality experience.

Reviews.Title: “Average for the category - Overrated”
Reviews.Author: lebon1973
Reviews.Content: When you enter a 5-star luxury hotel, you expect the best. So Wellington doesn't keep the promise in full. Some things are good, some are very poor. You pay for a high-end accomodation, but you. Of course the hotel is beautiful and conveniently located (minutes away from subway, the Retire Park) in downtown madrid. But that's it. The room was not so spacious (and it's ok considering it's an old building) but the amenities are so and so. There's an Ipod dock with radio alarm which is very good, but the furniture is dull and the wardrobe was ugly. No slipperies, no coffe/tea machine. The Mini-bar was ok, though. Tv was small and bad located in the room. The floor staff is very friendly and nice, but I cannot say the same for the concierge. The day I checked out they insist I had to pay the room (while it was paid by my corporation) and I had to ask them 3 times to check with the agency. They didn't believe me and they made me loose 20 minutes to check-out and then I was late at my meeting. On top of that, no one saying me "sorry" for the mistake. Very disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “Spanish Delight”
Reviews.Author: Royaltravel
Reviews.Content: Don't pass up the chance to stay at the Hotel Wellington in Madrid. Very nice rooms with great service. They make you feel special. In fact, the bull fighters stay at this hotel. There are plenty of restaurants in the area or just eat at the hotel. We loved the pool area. The neighborhood is very fancy with designer shops everywhere. We walked to Retiro Park to help with the jet lag. It was a holiday and everyone was out with their families enjoying the beautiful weather.

Reviews.Title: “Madrid visit”
Reviews.Author: Mark B
Reviews.Content: Four of us stayed at the hotel as a base for visiting the city and playing tennis over 4 days. The hotel served it's purpose admirably being located in an 'up market' area of the city. We could walk to local bars or take a taxi into the more lively parts of the city. Rooms were clean and the buffet breakfast was as you would expect. We only used the hotel as a base but the staff were most helpful and had a sense of humour.

Reviews.Title: “The Wellington Hotel, Madrid”
Reviews.Author: lyd678
Reviews.Content: JUST returned from having stayed at The Wellington Hotel in Madrid and have to say it is wonderful! The location & service are second to none! Anything you ask for comes in minutes, lightbulb, towels & even a third bed in our room! We had an executive room and is was really spacious. The breakfast is supurb and served until 11am with no rush to get you out. The staff are polite & friendly and for shopping the location is second to none. There is an outdoor pool, spa, hair salon & Gym....could you ask for anything more....will certainly be going back!

Reviews.Title: “Sweet stay!”
Reviews.Author: Dee N
Reviews.Content: On a whim we bought a livingsocial coupon to this place and we were mighty pleased at how well it turned out. We spent 3 nights here. The pool is awesome, the service is great, the room was clean with a lot of the essentials to make you want nothing. The rooms are quiet clean. Although the TV was lacking in English channels and the minibar was stocked completly with beverages that show up in your receipt if you touch them, we really enjoyed the overall experience. The breakfast was very good with a lot of options. This hotel is centrally located between 2 metro stations and you practically walk to SOL from here. And there's a fantastic handbag store on this street - dont miss it!

Reviews.Title: “An excellent traditional hotel with modern conveniences”
Reviews.Author: LordJeffrey
Reviews.Content: This old style elegant hotel with modern amenities including (paid) wi-fi in all rooms -- as well as free access computers in the mezzanine business center -- is ideally located in the elegant Salamanca neighborhood, a couple of blocks for the Retiro park and the boutiques and art galleries of Calle Serrano and its sourroundings. Service is outstandingly attentive, and the breakfast is varied and first-rate. There are plenty of restaurants nearby, and the major museums are easily accessible -- about 25-30 leisurely minutes on foot, and five or six by taxi. Rooms are spotlessly clean, and richly appointed bathrooms feature good showers, a welcome luxury not always found in older European hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful clean 5 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: Coopergirl03
Reviews.Content: Spent 4 nights from 9/9/2011 in a twin bedroom, the hotel is spotlessly clean and attention to detail second to none. At the end of the street is Retiro Park beautiful and a lovely place to enjoy a coffee in the morning. The hotel in situated in the Salamanca area very nice part of Madrid it is in easy walking distant of the famous Gran Via (about 15 mins walk) and atocha station. Note The swimming pool is unheated and closes mid Sept - food expensive in hotel but looked very nice. Complimentary dressing gown and slippers provided in your room a nice touch too. You won't be disappointed :0)

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: allyson360
Reviews.Content: Very beautiful old European style hotel. Lovely breakfast in the morning. In a great location of Madrid close to restaurants, a beautiful park and a great shopping area. The only drawback was the lack of wireless internet. Very clean rooms and well supplied. Turn down service. With the exception of internet access (although there was a business computer room) I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Classy hotel, great location!”
Reviews.Author: thecolleen
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Wellington Hotel, a friend had recommended it. I was not disappointed! Firstly the desk staff are amazingly helpful, and there is a taxi rank right outside the hotel. The room I had was lovely, beautiful bed linen, comfy beds, overlooking the pool with a balcony, the turn down service is a lovely touch. Located on Calle de Velazquez, the hotel is within a short hop of all the best shopping in Madrid as well as being close to the Retiro Park, Paseao del Prado. There are some lovely tapas bars, within a few minutes walk, to while away an hour or so over a glass of wine. I stayed in early July when the temperatures were high and the hotel's pool is a little gem in the centre of Madrid. I'll be back!!!

Reviews.Title: “Its worth going just for the breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Tez from Oz
Reviews.Content: my wife and I had 3 nights here and loved it. The check in was efficent, room comfortable with a great bathroom. The location is fantastic right next to Retiro Park and metro stop so you are only a few stops away from the centre. Best of all was the breakfast which not only had great variety but everything was was the best in its class, from the freshly squeezed orange juice to the smoked salmon and freshly carved jamon, this is a classy experience it self. The surrounding area was classy and comfortable stroll to the top class shopping strips. For a touch of affordable class you can't go wrong

Reviews.Title: “Nice to place to get over jet lag”
Reviews.Author: smynyc
Reviews.Content: Usually my choice of hotel is less staid, and less expensive, than the Wellington but Madrid was the first leg of a multiple city trip and I wanted to insure myself a comfortable bed in which to make up for sleep lost in traveling. The hotel is well located, close to Retiro park, a short walk to Chueca, and the rooms are clean and, most important, the beds are comfortable. The staff is always courteous, the outdoor bar is pleasant and they have a pool. A very relaxing place.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Todopormazatlan
Reviews.Content: This is a very good elegant hotel, i was a little concerned about a older botel, but its very well apointed, rooms are very good size, with all amenities and the bathroms are full size, tub, twin sinks, very complete. It has also an award winning restaurant, if i only have one request the internet service provided by other outside company its alittle bit uncomfortable. In general tems a very good classic, elegant hotel, with overall good service, and very clean.

Reviews.Title: “A cool oasis old world class great”
Reviews.Author: TrevorNW6
Reviews.Content: A very convenient relaxing hotel, excellent service, spacious rooms and perfect pool for hot Madrid on July

Reviews.Title: “Classy Hotel in Great Location”
Reviews.Author: speedymcqueen
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for three night city break. Hotel is easy to get to from the airport using the Metro. (Madrid's Metro system is excellent,very cheap,very clean and simple to use). Check in was painless and overall reception desk staff were kind and courteous. It's noticeable that staff will always start a conversation in Spanish (it's Spain what else would you expect doh!) but readily revert to English,and seemed to appreciate it if we made the effort to greet them in Spanish. Those reviewers who complained about the staff's lack of English should probably go on holiday to Benidorm. This is the heart of Spain and Madrilenas are justifiably proud of their heritage and language. Our room was a superior with breakfast included in the rate. The room was spacious with plenty of hanging space and a generous sized bathroom. The air-con was adequate,on full settings it kept the room comfortably cool but not ice cold. I was very amused by the sign on the rooms mini bar warning that it was electronically monitored and simply moving items would mean they would be charged to my bill. Bed was huge and very comfortable. Turn down service was never missed however late we left the room to go out for the evening and room was very clean. The public spaces are tastefully decorated and reflect the hotels star rating and history.People have comment on the small lifts??? There are two in the lobby, they are immaculate and we never waited for one! I can't comment on the pool and related facilities as on returning to the hotel mid-afternoon it was always packed-out,so if you want a sunbed you need to get there early as space is limited. Many people have commented on the maitre "d" and restaurant staff at breakfast . I can only observe that they were very professional,efficient and attentive. We never waited to be seated,coffee was brought to the table immediately and the buffet was perfectly adequate. The chef's were constantly checking food and more than happy to comply with personal requests (the family seated near to us were brought freshly cooked churros on request). The location in my opinion is excellent. Retiro Park is only a block away.We spent Sunday in the park,it's and excellent family day out with live music in the bandstand and lots to see(highly recommended). A taxi to Plaza Mayor from outside the hotel costs 7 euros with a tip included,or there is a Metro station within a few hundred yards and all journeys cost 1 (yes one!) euro to any destination. Being a veteran of city breaks (been to virtually every major european capital and then some) I was impressed with Madrid,it retains some authenticity and has not "sold out" simply to cater for tourists in the way other cities have. But back to the Welllington,why no five stars ? We would have loved to use the bar/ lounge area but cocktails/drinks are massively over priced (in my humble opinion) and during our stay there did not seem to be many guests indulging. Would I stay here again,definitely!

Reviews.Title: “Great Service”
Reviews.Author: Nani1212
Reviews.Content: This is my second stay at the Wellington. Rooms are nice, and bathrooms are really nice. The service is impeccable. Breakfast was simple but it was very elegant. You have to remember that you're in Europe 'cause the elevators are small. It's a very old hotel but location is THE BEST. I do speak Spanish so that make things extremely easy for us. Staff was very friendly and extremely attentive.

Reviews.Title: “Very faded and terrible service”
Reviews.Author: Yogaschooldropout
Reviews.Content: My bathroom was a delicate shade of puce and the room was tiny. The maitre de was extremely rude - literally barring me from having breakfast until I produced my room key. When I had finally convinced him I wasnt an outsider trying to score a free breakfast he sat me in the middle of three tables of Japanese tourists. I complained at reception but only one of the reception staff spoke english! So I wrote a letter of complaint and heard nothing back.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: fdf123
Reviews.Content: Hotel recommended to us by friend who travels to Spain frequently, said, "it's the place where the bullfighters stay" (although we didn't knowingly see any). The room was spacious and nice, very comfortable bed, the staff was friendly and helpful, and the location was good--close to the major museums and park. The breakfast buffet is terrific! We took advantage of a wk-end package that included it. Nearest metro station only a block or 2 away. Hotel was also able to accommodate an early check-in, great after a transatlantic flight. Free wifi but one had to obtain a daily login/password from front desk, and would only allow 1 device to login at a time.

Reviews.Title: “Great to swim and sit around pool / bar and escape the heat. Best Sushi ever.”
Reviews.Author: sashalute
Reviews.Content: Very happy, helpful and attentive staff, a few small problems that were fixed quckly. Japanese restaurant booked out (reputation brilliant and hard to get in) so we had sushi by the pool. An oasis.

Reviews.Title: “Worth every penny”
Reviews.Author: andhub
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel Good rooms Well mannered staff Good Bar (although need to get more Gins) Restaurant excellent Fantastic

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious, old world hotel”
Reviews.Author: LittleYarYar
Reviews.Content: The room we stayed in was large, clean and comfortable. The bathroom was spacious with two sinks and had a separate area for the WC/bidet. The feel of the hotel was luxurious. It had an elegantly decorated seating area, including a private function room hidden behind a panel of books. Our room was on the second floor and on the side of the night club so unfortunately it was quite noisy. Others in our group did not seem to have this problem, so the noise level depends on the location of the room. The food at the restaurant was of a very high quality. Next to the business centre, there is a room with internet terminals and a printer free for hotel guests to use.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent 5* hotel in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: FrequentTraveller36
Reviews.Content: Elegant hotel decorated with the style of the 50s. Not the first time in this hotel, I’ve stayed one week last Easter. Bilingual, courteous, and highly professional staff makes the client’s stay enjoyable. Excellent location in Madrid (Salamanca), though in an upscale neighborhood a relatively quiet one, 200 m to the Retiro Park and close to other interesting parts of the city. Walking distance to many elegant restaurants, bars and shops (i.e. the Corte Inglés located in Goya Street opens on Sundays also). Suites are very spacious, very well maintained, mattress, sheets, pillows, towels, curtains and carpets are very clean, fresh flowers, complimentary water and fruits are placed in the room almost on a daily basis. All in all one of my favorite hotels in Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “The hotel is in deep need of renovation, very old design hotel.”
Reviews.Author: ohashem1
Reviews.Content: I had to stay in this hotel due to the proximity of it's location to my business meetings, orient want to stay there as the reviews were not encouraging, but then it ended up to stay there in a suite, in summary, run down furniture, non working AC, staff who barely speak English, noisy hotel, old bathroom, bad reception area, not even a ramp for your luggage, if you are going for madridmto enjoy, this is not the hotelnyounwant to stay at, if you had to, it's not gonna kill ya.

Reviews.Title: “Not what I expected”
Reviews.Author: ATWTraveler
Reviews.Content: Although the Wellington is historic and beautiful, and the staff friendly, it was a bit of a disappointment for a five star hotel. Our room was located next to the elevator- noisy. Linen sheets may sound luxurious, but 300+ count Egyptian cotton are much softer. The shower head leaked onto the floor. Maybe we were expecting too much after reading all the positive reviews, but the four star hotel we stayed at near the train station was actually more comfortable. Oh, well...

Reviews.Title: “Very good, close enough to 5 star for me”
Reviews.Author: Lanie54
Reviews.Content: We recently spent 1 night at the Wellington at the end of a trip to Spain. We had been in Madrid earlier in the week, loved the Salamanca neighborhood, but weren't excited about our first hotel. While out on a walk, we passed the Wellington and a few days later, made a reservation on-line. The location is terrific -- close enough to walk to the Retiro or art museums and since we enjoy walking, we easily walked to the Plaza Mayor and Palace one day. The neighborhood is lovely, lots of smaller streets with trees, beautiful shops, plenty of dining options. We far preferred this location to being right by the museums or Puerta del Sol where there are mobs of people/tourists. The public spaces retain some historic flavor; some people might find that a little dated, but we liked it. (Note: if you like ultramodern decor, this is not the place for you.) We opted for a superior room and were very pleased -- it was large, with a big window facing a quiet side street, beautifully furnished/decorated (we were told it was recently renovated). It was very tasteful and definitely larger than the room we'd had a few years ago at the Westin Palace in Madrid. The bathrooms are somewhat small, since the hotel was built in the 50's, but plenty big enough and had 2 sinks with really nice toiletries, towels etc. We did not have breakfast, since we were leaving for an early flight, so I can't comment on the quality or cost. As for services -- we didn't get off to the best start only in that when we arrived, the front desk gentleman was clearly busy with some other issue or problem. It took several minutes for him to look up and greet us, let alone begin the check-in process and when he did, he was still attending to another matter so we did not have his full attention. Not a great start, but I have to believe that is not the norm. We did have to go along with someone taking us to our room, but he was friendly, told us about the hotel and didn't linger. Our suitcases arrived promptly. We immediately went out for a few hours and on our return, found 2 boxes of Leonidas chocolates and 2 upscale bottled waters waiting on a silver tray. Nice touch. And soon after, when we discovered that the air conditioning wasn't working very well, we had an excellent experience with service. My husband called the front desk, the person was efficient and kind about the problem, and a maintenance person arrived very quickly. He fixed the issue very quickly, was very friendly and attentive, and took the time to make sure it was truly solved, so there would not be a second call. Yes, that's how a 5 star property should handle things, but it doesn't always happen. I don't often stay in 5 star hotels, so it's hard for me to compare the Wellingon with its competition. We know we liked it better than the Palace -- less stuffy, more intimate, better neighborhood. Compared to London, Paris or Rome, I think hotel prices in Madrid are much more reasonable anyway, so I think the Wellington is great value for money. We'd go back any time.

Reviews.Title: “Good”
Reviews.Author: JokyF
Reviews.Content: I was at the hotel for the weekend. I asked to change the room that I had been assigned and the Concierge was very helpful. The cleanliness is excellent and the staff is always available. The hotel is situated in the shopping area typical of Madrid and at the same time close to tourist attractions. The hotel is quite and English style. Many thanks to Mr. Juan for his courtesy. Mr and Mrs Morellato

Reviews.Title: “OK, though I had expected more”
Reviews.Author: sanninana
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel because of the location, the good reviews, the gym and the swimming pool. I was satisfied with most points, but some things disturbed our stay. The swimming pool is closed in March, the gym is equipped with mostly complicated machines, without a lot of space for mats or for individual workout, and internet costs 15 Euros for 24 hours, which is certainly too much. The rooms are nice and clean, the service is good and friendly (they would even greet you sometimes if you enter the hotel in wet jogging clothes). We were not afraid to leave cameras or iPads in the room . The location is just fantastic for a city visit. You can reach everything easily, the park is a great orientation (even on the Metro map). You can always go out for a walk, shopping or to a nearby place to have some tapas. The restaurant dining facilities did not really tempt us, though.

Reviews.Title: “A Grand Hotel with top shelf customer satisfaction focus”
Reviews.Author: Serge J
Reviews.Content: The Wellington was exactly as described, a Grand Hotel close to the former Royal gardens, the Prado, and numerous other museums. The common areas could use a touch up, but the rooms are excellent, nicely appointed and very clean, the bed extremely comfortable. What set this hotel apart is its customer satisfaction focus. We checked in late at night and ended up in a room with a leak in the bathroom. After a little bit of back and forth the manager not only put is in a nicer room, but also added a little gift when we got back to the room. A touch of attention many of today's hotels have lost. The hotel also houses the absolute best Basque restaurant in town, Restaurant Goizeko. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “A week on business”
Reviews.Author: travellerjeny
Reviews.Content: This hotel has excellent service. As another traveler stated, the hotel is in need of renovation, but that is underway. One of my colleagues was given a room that was renovated and very spacious. As we were staying for a week, I requested to be moved into a renovated room and the request was granted very graciously. The front desk staff was helpful and courteous. I wish the fitness room were open longer hours, but this was a nice stay in Madrid. Definitely five stars by European standards and the updated rooms are very nice. It is also a short walk from the metro station and Retiro Park.

Reviews.Title: “5 star service, but hotel desperately needs remodeling”
Reviews.Author: co2il
Reviews.Content: During our stay, we were originally were in a superiour room on the 2nd floor, but a nearby store was having a grand opening and had a dj playing loud techno music (until 6am according to the front desk) that seemed like it was coming from just outside the room in the lobby. After talking to the front desk, they moved us to a basic room on the 4th floor on the opposite side of the hotel just to sleep (left everything in other room). Unfortunately this room's A/c unit was broken and made a very high pitch when it was turned on. They sent up a repair man to look at it, by now it is like 4am. After a couple quick attempts he could not fix it and got me a new room and went with me to make sure everything worked in the new room. Everything did, and we got several hours of sleep finally. Very happy with how that was handled by the staff. The next night we were moved permantly to the 4th floor, but was downgraded to the basic room, because it was all they had left. If it was quiet, we were not complaining at the point since the previously mentioned dj was playing again tonight. We could barely make out the dj music with no other noise in the room, so with the ac on we were fine. The superiour room was beautiful and roomy, still needed an updating though. The basic rooms were tiny. It is definetly worth the extra amount to upgrade. Bathrooms are the same, a lot more room and nicer fixtures and extra space in the superiour bathroom. Basic bathroom was small and we had to take turns getting ready, because we kept running into each with both of us in there. Breakfast was good, got it as part of package, wouldn't pay the ala carte price for what you get. Pool and spa area were nice, but not great. Again, got it as part of package and wouldn't pay the normal ala carte price unless you were going to spend the day using the pool, spa, and fitness room, then would be worth it.

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant surprise”
Reviews.Author: OCMitford
Reviews.Content: Despite a mediocre review critiquing the hotel because of the ongoing renovations, my family and I decided to stay anyway. Upon entering the hotel we were impressed by the gorgeous lobby and lounge, but we suspended judgment until we saw our rooms due to the aforementioned review. To our great delight, the rooms and staff were wonderful. Although there were renovations being performed during our stay, they were, for the most part, not a nuisance. (The most annoying effect of the renovations was that there was only one functioning elevator.) Everything from the marble bathrooms to the lovely linens to the room service (with French china) was a 5-star experience. We highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel with some historical flair”
Reviews.Author: huvevi
Reviews.Content: Hotel with some historical flair, perfectly well located, quiet spacious bedrooms, excellent breakfast buffet, sometimes indifferent staff, almost exclusively spanish speaking, what is surprising for a European capital.

Reviews.Title: “European chic, excellent location, beautiful bar, great breakfast”
Reviews.Author: theobstinatetraveler
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for a whirlwind trip to Madrid over Thanksgiving last year. First on location, we were very pleased with this choice on the edge of Salamanca. Salamanca is a beautiful, upscale shopping and living area, only about a 10-15 minute walk to the Prado. You are surrounded by locals and not tourists. There are a few great tapas bars in the neighborhood - I"m sorry I've forgotten the names but just walk around the neighborhood of the hotel and you will run into some great options, along with art galleries and all the top name designer shops. Our room was very large by European standards with a completely comfortable matress. We slept very well. Breakfast was ELEGANT - I have never seen so many well-dressed and well-behaved families from all over the globe. The breakfast buffet really tried to provide something for every culture - whether Japanese or American or Swedish. It was replenished often and I have no complaints about the service. The bar is an elegant way to end your evening. Service later night was a little slow but it was very fun to be surrounded by all the dressed up patrons coming home after a night of revelry. Had a great champage cocktail in a beautiful setting. I would say the one thing that may make some uncomfortable is that the front desk staff are not all completely fluent in English. At times I had more success using my limited Spanish. The important thing, however, is that everyone on staff that we encountered was trying to help us and if it took a combination of English and Spanish to get there - so be it. I'm sure if you spoke no Spanish, that it would work out fine too as one staff member would consult another if he or she didn't understand something. Their English is still better than my Spanish. I think this hotel is an excellent value for what it offers and would highly recommend it for a trip to Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent except for....”
Reviews.Author: bmore5219
Reviews.Content: I should start this review by saying that I had originally planned to take this trip, and thus stay at Hotel Wellington, about two weeks before we actually stayed there. Unfortunately, there was a death in my girlfriend’s family so we had to reschedule. Initially I tried to cancel the trip but because I booked it through travelzoo.com they wouldn’t allow me to cancel. After exchanging a few emails, they essentially gave me a credit that could be used within the year- they were very helpful. We rescheduled the trip and arrived at Hotel Wellington. From the first second it was class all the way. I had never stayed at a five star before and now I see what I’ve been missing. From the front desk, to the gymnasium assistant, to the pool assistant, the staff was remarkable. They were always there to answer questions. They said they only spoke a little English but we had no problem communicating. The location is great. There is a bus stop and tourist double decker bus stop right out of the hotel (the double decker runs until midnight!) The only issue was that they are upgrading the hotel so every morning somewhere between 8 and 9 am we heard banging from the construction workers; Again, not a big deal for us because we were there for Madrid not the hotel but if you plan on sleeping in late it may be a problem. That being said, I would definitely recommend it to anyone. It was a wonderful experience and made Madrid that much more enjoyable. P.S. EXCELLENT GYM

Reviews.Title: “Really dissapointing service”
Reviews.Author: myhotels
Reviews.Content: I stalyed for a weekend with friends in Madrid and I wanted a nice hotel as I was staying by myself and wanted a little treat, so I booked a superior room directly on the hotel web (prices were the cheapest I found on other booking pages). When I arrived at the hotel I remarked TWICE tha I had booked a superior room and they confirmed. To my surprise, they sent me to an old, non-renovated, interior patio, lower floor room! I said I did not want that room and to my surprise they sent me to the room on the top floors, which are the ones corresponding to the superior rooms (renovated, with extra services, etc..) SO, THEY HAD TRIED TO FOOL ME INTO THIS HORRIBLE OLD ROOM! Really dissapointed, NEVER AGAIN!

Reviews.Title: “Fall in love with Madrid at the Wellington Hotel”
Reviews.Author: georgiawendy
Reviews.Content: From the time you arrive in a taxi you are taken care of. You do not have to touch your bags again until you open them in your room. The front desk was so welcoming and took care of any request that you had. The breakfast was one of the best you will experience and even though it is a buffet, the chef is available for anything you might desire, i.e., eggs prepared "your way". Their new coffee machine makes the very best expresso EVER. You can even do it yourself. Rooms are beautifully appointed and clean and the beds deliciously comfy. To top it off, the Wellington Hotel is the traditional hotel for bullfighters to dress before they go to the ring. As we were there on a night of a bullfight we have an opportunity to see the entire group leaving the hotel before the event.

Reviews.Title: “Stay somewhere else”
Reviews.Author: Stewstoys
Reviews.Content: A tired hotel. I got trapped in elevator and there was no response to emergency button, which seemingly sounded only inside the elevator! Fortunately was able to text message wife who alerted front desk and had to push them to act. They appeared unaware of problem. Over 25 minutes to get out (in an unsafe manner). Staff showed no concern when I did get out. Not a great location either.

Reviews.Title: “Not interested in tourists, just the locals”
Reviews.Author: Annanomibus
Reviews.Content: I have benefited from Trip Adviser reviews, so I wish to share my experiences here with you. This is a wonderfully situated 5 star hotel. The Hotel has a strong local clientele and they give the impression that they are not that interested in toursists. There is no concierge desk and the front desk staff handle these tasks. I have travelled widely and these staff were the rudest I have ever encountered. I was roundly ignored by three staff on one occasion. On another, the receptionist interrupted our converstaion to start chatting (in Spanish) to another guest passing through the lobby. He even tried to grab my pen to start giving the other person some information. Another negative is that the pool area is being renovated. This includes jackhammering that commenced at 7.40am. On returning to the hotel at 9pm one evening, we wished to dine in house. We asked to be fitted in for one couse only, perhaps a quick bowl of soup? The restaurant was entirely empty, except for one table of two matrons. The restaurant could not accommodate us. I accept that they may have been fully booked, but not to be able to assist was very unhelpful. Finally, there is an elegant lounge in the lobby, filled with cigar smoke. We had previously had three nights at the Westin Palace and recommend it for the smoke free atmosphere, location and service. Disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Make sure u look at ur bill.”
Reviews.Author: ELLABLEUE
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Wellington hotel at the end of March till April 5th. I have to say in terms of decor, location; it is pretty good. I was literally 5 minutes away from the center of Madrid by Metro. There were a couple of glitches. 1) the power went out of my room for 5 minutes n it was fixed right away. 2) There was a strong smell of sewage in the bathroom 3) Rooom service was efficient however the ppl answering the phone hung up a couple of times on me. 3) When it came time to check out of the hotel, I was overcharged for breakfast, I was charged 39 euros for a fax which the ppl did not mention that I was gonna get charged for. Also, when I disputed my bill, the ppl at the front desk got quite rude. I left steaming. I would not go back. In my opinion, it is overpriced. Breakfast was disguting; watery eggs n pastry thats all..... utter disapointment.

Reviews.Title: “classical hotel and top quality "old fashioned" great service”
Reviews.Author: Travelleralways2
Reviews.Content: stayed here for two nights for work. this hotel reminded me of places from my childhood - staff who really know and have pride in their work, extremely helpful and courteous; great starched linens on quality beds; ornate common areas excellent for meetings and a buffet breakfast doing something for everyone. it's the real thing and you certainly walk back in time in a most pleasant way.

Reviews.Title: “Not the coziest place if you're a leftist, albeit a great hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Liilak
Reviews.Content: I stayed there for four nights following my parents' advice, who are regular clients. The hotel is a legend on its own in Madrid and one can easily see why: its location is superb and the place comes out as posh and with a classic elegance to it. Staff is attentive and professional and I can't praise enough the excellent breakfast they offer. Rooms are spacious, clean and with a classic decor, even if I found ours was starting to need a bit of an update, esp. as regards the bathroom (details that, albeit small, should be dealt with on account of the high price you're paying). The only downside is that the hotel does not bother to hide its right-leaning stand: only right-wing newspapers are available ("El País" was nowhere to be seen) and the atmosphere is definitely conservative. Not that it bothers me, but I think some travellers might find that a bit uptight. Finally, I highly recommend their Kabuki Wellington restaurant; granted, you'll spend a lot of money, but it'll be worth every single euro.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, classic feel to the place”
Reviews.Author: ketel_always
Reviews.Content: Judging by it's location, doorman and the well appointed lobby, you get the impression that your stay will be a top shelf experience right off the bat. I noticed all the old pictures of bull fighters that stayed and rested in the hotel before the big events and it just had me thinking of Hemingway's Spain before the civil war although I don’t think it’s that old. My rate was OK, just a little on the high side for Madrid in Feb. The room was clean fairly large and the bathroom was clean, well maintained and functional but it could use a remodel. The location is away from the bustle of Gran Via where I normally stay which was a plus this trip. Been there done that. El Prado and Parque Rietro are nearby along with Puerta de Alcala. All in all this is the spot for the more sophisticated traveler that likes an upscale look but doesn’t want to spend $400 a night. Great for wondering around away from the crowd. If you're expecting the Westin Palace at this price you'll be disappointed. People on these forums crack me up when they moan about a place as if they've paid top dollar. When you’re in this range, just hope the value lives up to the price and if it's better, then great. But don't expect to pay mid range and get the Ritz. If you want the crowd and the buzz of Madrid, stay at the Atlantico.

Reviews.Title: “I'd stay elsewhere for a variety of reasons”
Reviews.Author: nnsanci
Reviews.Content: As a solo female traveler with lots of opportunities for weekends away, I am very careful about where I stay -- you can see that I usually give great reviews because I am very thoughtful and do my homework about places to stay. Last time I was in Madrid, I stayed at a small pension off the Gran Via and decided to try a new part of town. I wouldn't stay here again for a short weekend trip to Madrid -- I'd stay over near the Palacio Real or the Prado (the SAS Radisson looked quite nice -- quiet yet relatively central location.) I decided to stay here because of the excellent spa/gym facilities. Well, that part of the hotel is only open 10 - 6, making it completely useless to me. There is a pool area, but it was closed for the Winter. I noticed that there is parking directly under the hotel -- so if you have a car, this may be a good option for you. This hotel is in a nice residential part of Madrid, with lots of high-end boutiques open for shopping -- but all are closed on Sundays. I didn't notice other hotels in the immediate area -- so if you need to be in this particular part of Madrid, this might be your best option. The room -- mold in the shower and scuffmarks on the walls. Internet connection in the room (cable, not wireless) did not work. There is a small business center with 3 or 4 computers for general use. Breakfast was 22Euros -- not included in the room price I got on Expedia. I thought the quality of the food was quite good -- but I still don't eat 30 USD worth of food for breakfast. The doorman and other staff were quite pleasant and very amused (and seemingly appreciative) of my Spanish language attempts. They were very helpful and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “good perhaps, but unconvincing in its class”
Reviews.Author: derob
Reviews.Content: Let me be straight. We were paying 140 Euro per night including breakfast for single occupancy, which was excellent value. With that in mind I should say that it is nothing short of excellent. However in particular the quality of the room makes me think differently on an absolute scale. The room I was staying in was tired. The windows were just plain bad, and could not close completely. Given the street noise, that was a problem. It was also impossible to control the heat; it was very warm. Opening the window let in even more noise from the street and made the heating work harder. Despite the excellent bed, my sleep was less then optimal. I was not convinced by the breakfast buffet either. I would not like to pay a lot of money for it. It wasn't bad, but the choice of really healthy food was limited. The abundance of carpets could be a problem for those having allergies. The hotel is located alright, but I think some other hotels are even more central. The close proximity of the Retiro park is an asset though, and some nice restaurants can be found two blocks down the road. A real asset in summer would be the terrace and the outdoor swimming pool. Given the weather we could not use it, but I am sure that this will be a very enjoyable place when the weather improves, worth additional money. The friendliness and helpfulness of the staff could not be faulted, and also the lunches we got were excellent. I would advise a friend to look for another hotel when having to pay substantially more then we did (likely), based on the quality of the room, but mention the potential benefit of the swimming pool first.

Reviews.Title: “A real gem”
Reviews.Author: greenjacket6
Reviews.Content: We had a delightful stay over Christmas week. Our (upgraded) rooms were elegant and quiet, with comfortable beds and spacious marble bathrooms. We did not see a concierge, but the front desk staff and doormen could not have been more helpful - all very kind, all spoke English. The location was excellent, just above Retiro and within walking distance of the major museums - also very close to a Metro stop. Breakfast was superb, with many specialty items, charming service, and Christmas carols playing softly in the background. Room service was quick and very good, even late in the evenings. We look forward to returning.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: CitigirlLondon
Reviews.Content: This really is a superb hotel. It caters for single female travellers. I had a splendid room, not a box and the bed linen was real linen. The breakfasts are brilliant, not the usual limited range, catering for a range of people. The staff are also exceedingly helpful. It's in a fabulous location and close to several metro stationsn. Would definitely go back and stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at a great hotel.”
Reviews.Author: HillaryR
Reviews.Content: Delighted we chose the Wellington Hotel. Apart from it being situated in a beautiful part of Madrid, and in easy walking distance to the Prado, and a short stroll to upmarket shopping and dining, the hotel has a quiet, sophisticated charm, that is often lacking in smart hotels these days. It has no doubt been updated over the years, but thankfully it retains a yesteryear romantic presence. The staff wee welcoming, efficient, and polite. Our room/bathroom was spacious, immaculate, and impossible to fault. Superior breakfast, and the bistro was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Well situated true 4-star hotel - relatively expensive but worth the price”
Reviews.Author: DRouatt
Reviews.Content: The Wellington is very centrally located, "within walking distance of the Prado and the Reine Sophia modern art museums", kitty-corner to the Park de Retiro (Madrid's very nice and beautiful version of Central Park). Very nice sized rooms excellent bathroom with huge tub - rooms are good value for the price - but with the value of the Euro vs. the US $$ everything is very expensive in Madrid. Ask for a high room. The street the hotel is on is qyuite trafficked and noisy. If you are on the fofth or sith floor or higher the noise mutes. Maybe ask for a room that doesn't face the main street. We paid 160 Euros a nite over 3-nites. Skip the 35 Euro breakfast in the Hotel and go into to "cafeteria" downstairs at the Wellington. Coffee (2) and a croissant is about 5 Euros. Sit upstairs in the Cafeteria in non-smoking. There are also several other cafeterias down the street but not better or cheaper. The hotel suggested 2 very good restaurantes within walking distance. Excellent foos but expensive. Ask for an English Menu and ask for non-smoking. Nothing and I mean nothing opens until at least 8:30 PM and then you are sitting in an empty restaurante. Everyone smokes so ask for non-smoking section. They have them. PS The hotel's outdoor pool was not open and probably is only open in the summer.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great service”
Reviews.Author: duals222
Reviews.Content: I went to Madrid for a concert at the Palacio de Deportes De la Comunidad and chose this hotel for convenience. It is within walking distance and the area feels safe.
