The reception staff spoke English and were lovely. Although I had booked a single room it was spacious and I didn't feel as if I'd drawn the short straw. The bathroom had the usual toiletries + anything else that you might need, including a toothbrush. I used room service and was delighted to find that the cheese sandwhich I ordered turned out to be more of a 'toastie' and came with chips and coleslaw. The accompanying coffee with hot milk made 2 cups and was delicious. All this for a very reasonable 16 euros. Breakfast was included in the deal I got with Octopus and looked fantastic with a lot of variety, but as a veggie I only had juice, bread and coffee. Although this is a 5* hotel, and the service certainly is, I didn't feel intimidated as a lone traveller. I can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Yet another great stay at the Wellington”
Reviews.Author: Anne B
Reviews.Content: I always stay at the Wellington.. This stay was a few days longer than prior visits. Once again I received great service, a wonderful room and an amazing bathroom with a multi level spray shower. Also check the rates if you think you can't afford the Wellington. I paid a lot less than the "average price" figure used here.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a beautiful neighbourhoood”
Reviews.Author: phoenikia
Reviews.Content: I was impressed with the Wellington. Great location, nice amenities, helpful staff. I liked the location, which was about a 15 minute walk from the Prado. Good breakfast, with fresh squeezed oj, and nice selection of meats, cheeses, pastries, breads, etc. Good coffee. They also have a Nespresso machine, if you like making your own espresso. The breakfast was served in a grand dining room. The beds were very comfortable, and the rooms were nicely decorated. Great big marble bathroooms. I would be happy to stay at the Wellington on a future trip to Madrid. One nice surprise was that 3 computer terminals were available for internet access, which meant that there usually wasn't a wait to use the computer. One small disappointment at the Wellington was one particular concierge's strong suggestion of a nearby restaurant, when I asked him about the distance to a particular restaurant that had been recommended in another neighbourhood. We ended up dining at the restaurant he suggested (which ended up being a chain restaurant specializing in rice dishes), hoping it would be something special if the concierge at such a good hotel recommended it, but the food was disappointing. I'm not sure if he only directs English speaking tourists/travellers to this type of restaurant, but it certainly wasn't the type of restaurant I would choose for a special dinner in Madrid. This hotel attracted a lot of international guests. Almost none of the other guests were Spanish speakers.

Reviews.Title: “Worth Going Back To”
Reviews.Author: ajmith
Reviews.Content: Stayed at The Wellington for 3 nights with my wife in July. We chose this hotel because it is only one of 3 in Madrid with a pool. Unfortunately the pool was closed for refurbishment though. We booked directly with the hotel who give a room upgrade to Amex cardholders if you pay with this card. I had boked an executive room but we were upgraded to a one bedroom suite which had two balconies- perfect for sitting out on and having a drink when you retired to your room at night. Breakfast was excellent. Great location in Madrid opposite Retiro Park and about a 20 minute walk to the Gran Via. There were a number of restaurants nearby and a fantastic tapas bar literally round the corner. Would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “A warm welcome, nice rooms, great breakfast in upscale area of Madrid”
Reviews.Author: Dutchtreat
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Wellington two times for 2 nights each early July 2009. The service was excellent, the breakfast superior and the rooms were well appointed and clean and had great beds. The Salamanca area is an upscale section of Madrid with many high end shops, restaurants, bars, etc. It's safe and within short distance of Retiro Park, Prado musuem, etc. The reception staff and doormen was eager to be of assistance. We recommend this hotel highly.

Reviews.Title: “Really nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: armada69
Reviews.Content: The hotel is about 25 mins taxi ride from Madrid Airport, it costs approx €25, be warned they charge up to €5 extra for going to/from the airport, luggage and if travelling at the weekend. We arrived at the hotel on the Saturday and it was hot around 95F so we were hoping to spend the afternoon by the pool, as it turned out it was not due to open until the Monday 15th June, ok we thought! so after a quick check in but told our rooms would not be ready for another hour, we made our way to the Retiro Park which was 5 mins away. It was lovely and well worth visiting. On our return we were taken to our room, we had booked an executive room and glad we had as it was a good size. The bed was really comfortable and even though our room overlooked the busy road, there was little road traffic noise. On the 15th June the pool was still not opened and it was still closed when we left on the 19th June !!!!! very disappointing as this was one of the main reasons we chose this hotel over others. Madrid is a good city to visit with lots of interesting sites, however be aware that there is a lot of road works going on throughout the city, so staying in this hotel was a good choice as it is away from these works. The hotel is approx 20mins walk from Old Madrid but the tour bus stops right outside the hotel and for €17 a day you can use this to travel to the major sites in the city. Resturants nearby are pricey so be warned! it is cheaper to walk the 20 mins into somewhere like Plaza De Santa Ana where a bottle of house wine can costs as little as €10 !!! and a meal for 2 is about €40. A similar meal near the hotel would cost approx €80. It is safe walking back to the hotel at night, at no time did we feel uncomfortable, but taxi's are easy to get. If you want to eat near the hotel try Gino's Italian resturant a 5 mins walk from the hotel down Calle Del Hermosilla this is good value for money and cheaper than most places in the area. For a cup of coffee in the morning, try Delliea Coffee shop 2 roads down, it's the best value for money. The hotel breakfast is €28 each, so if it is not included in your room rate I'd advise you turn right and walk down to the Cafe's nearby. To conclude, this was a lovely hotel and we would stay here again, but with the heat, check to see if the pool is open before you book.

Reviews.Title: “almost the Ritz at half the price”
Reviews.Author: Regmaiche
Reviews.Content: Spent another week in this hotel in Salamanca district thus Location Beta ++ just across road from Retirolove the way the Madridlenos are so family orientated park full of families walking around excellent accordianist asked him to play La Cumparsita after 2 bars several people began to dance plenty of places for quick drink whittles Hotel Room good size excellent linen sheets duvets adequate chairs Bathroom usual accoutrements every conceivable accessory flannels an elegant square of fine linen asked Chambermaid what for reply so when step out of bed one’s tootsies dont not have to touch carpet shower system quite beyond my limited intellect to adjust above remarkably patient Cm Obliged with patient explanation. bathroom toiletries more than adequate flannel for my delicate complexion toothpaste comb bit funny as one end had to teeth never the less I pinched two in case on return to UK could not afford one Thanks to Chancellor of Exchequer brilliant financial planning. Soft furnishings carpet better than at home. Room near lifts no noise just put in new one as before was inadequate. Breakfast fortunately having booked inclusive thro agent Coy had hedged the currency no second mortgage needed £32 otherwise but apart from no kedgeree FEB everything one could need anyway for me consumed about 1800 calories as food Europe ruinous like going to Ramsay everyday -so only needed small dinner, Some one else given review mentioned shabby Lounge carpet asked staff about it apparently is handwoven costs about £200 per M2 silk & so is just rewoven when worn in situ - to me looked OK. Very elegant lady bit like girl in Brosnan Bond Halle Berry was it film equally Prada type suit walked around thought she was owners daughter, apparently the hotel security! No doubt tae kwandoo champ. Reception most efficient & courteous Helpful Doorman been there for 30 years one whistle taxis appeared like magic Could not fault the staff in any way immaculately turned out courteous & attentive even the M de who barked at me every morning room number but getting to know him found was a character – not many left these days Dinner the main restaurant called Gozeiko one needed a UK MPs Expenses like Home secretary including claiming for bath plug to go there but tried it once above reproach but absurdly priced -all expense accounts with men drinking wine 500 Euros bottle The ordinary snack bar restaurant was cheaper full of Spanish matured ladies eating together many complaining about cost of living & cost the Spanish favourite Iberico ham which is terribly expensive as the pigs are fed on some obscure nuts & 11 men are needed to pick 100grams Too fatty for me anyway. However veg soup & main course not dear good value. Excellent computer facilities free apart from funny situation of the @ symbol. Complaints none except again fed up with how expense accounts put up price of hotels & food &where is this money coming from you & me via our Pension schemes investments but to be fair many accept invites so adjust the odds to. All seminars should be held electronically by video. Would I stay there again yes definitely. Whilst was here had look at Preciados Hotel reviewed by several- no thanks clever photo - poor situation. Did I look for more modest place for those credit card sickly? One opposite the lovely station [resembles Chelsea Flower show] reception chap obviously retired Khmer Rouge corporal so requested to be shown round two rooms excellent about 50% less Amazing Place s often recommended about but ...??I walked to Palace Hotel some rave about it awful like staying in Milan station. Good bargain one two doors down an NH hotel good value for room shown . Cant remember name click on if going is good location. Would I stay there again Yes ?paying

Reviews.Title: “Nice choice in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: liamuk2
Reviews.Content: Stayed here to attend a couple of business meetings in Oct 2008. The hotel is in a nice location with a park across the street and looks nice from the outside. My only problem with the area is there are few restaurants / shops within the immediate vicinity and most seemed to be a 10 minute walk away. The staff seemed very friendly and spoke reasonably good English. Although the hotel is nice inside and out it is a little dated in feel - maybe a gentle refresh could be in order to bring the place up to date a little. The lifts were tiny and took an age to come. Breakfast and restaurant selections were great. Internet access in the rooms was fast and mini bars are provided. Would definitely consider staying here again (but would maybe consider somewhere a little more central next time)

Reviews.Title: “One of the Best Hotels in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: Mdap64
Reviews.Content: Quite simply, one of the best hotels in Madrid. A cut above. A professionally-run hotel. Spacious, plush rooms, palatial bathrooms, helpful staff, excellent location in downtown Madrid. Close to the Retiro Park. Excellent bar. A tad expensive, but worth it. They were offering deals for 4 nights or more.

Reviews.Title: “was not disappointed in the Wellington”
Reviews.Author: kokosandiego
Reviews.Content: Hotel in great location, nice walking area, good restaurants nearby. Rooms very clean, beds extremely comfortable, bath well appointed with all the necessary items available, linens and towells very good quality. Enjoyed the breakfast buffet, staff personable, efficient and helpful to a degree. For the price it met our needs totally, no street noise at all, area surrounding the rooms could be updated, but this was a minor fault, and we are particular about where we stay...this is not a 5 star but a solid 4 star property.

Reviews.Title: “Renovation needed”
Reviews.Author: gio39
Reviews.Content: Although location and service is ok the rooms (clean enough ) are very old styled and too depressing. Additionally exept reception there is a problem if you dont speak spanish , they hardly understand you. If you want to vist the center of the city you can even walk or use the subway that is safe and runs till late

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded our expectations”
Reviews.Author: dsn624
Reviews.Content: We did lots of research on this web site and others in choosing our hotel in Madrid and we are delighted to recommend the Hotel Wellington. The room was spacious, especially for Europe, as was the bathroom: we had a double room. The location is near all the major sights and is in the lovely Salamanca area - good shopping, very safe, near the Metro and quiet! Upon arrival at the airport, my friend's purse lifted. Do be very careful and wear your money under your clothes! She did not realize the loss until we neared the hotel. The Wellington staff could not have been nicer nor more helpful. We highly recommend the hotel for its location, comfort, and excellent staff. We'd return in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “A Let Down”
Reviews.Author: Davo666
Reviews.Content: Visited here based on reviews, and my expectations were not met. Issues included broken window fixings, poor ventilation, paper-thin walls in between rooms and a high cost of food and drink. After struggling to open the blinds I was treated to a view directly into another guest's room and on attempting to catch up on some news found the television not to be working. The shower failed to produce anything other than a slight drizzle of water and on leaving had to argue for 20 minutes about the fact that I had not once used the mini-bar. Good location is one redeemable factor.

Reviews.Title: “Comfy, well located, luxurious, classic European hotel”
Reviews.Author: puddytat1
Reviews.Content: My husband and our two teenage daughters booked two rooms in this classic but updated European hotel. Recommend at least floor four or higher because you are in a major city! Room was immaculate with slippers, robes, marble bathroom etc. Fantastic location two blocks from metro and a 20 minute walk to the Prado. Air conditioning in hotel rooms was spotty -- my only hesitation. But I'd stay there again. Wonderful city!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, great location but pricey”
Reviews.Author: SMCR
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely hotel. We were a bit boggled about finding it once we came out of the underground, but when we got our bearings it was only about 10 minutes walk away. The staff are friendly and helpful. There is a lovely little coffee bar in it for snacks, coffee and drinks, which always seemed busy. It works out a lot cheaper than dining in the main restaurant. Also there are a lot of lovely restaurants and fab shops just up the street. It was a great location for that. There is a night club a couple of doors down which stays open till the early hours of the morning. I didn't find the restaurants about the old town that great, and even the one the hotel recommended was over priced and heavy. The tapas bars are great value though and very tasty. We had room service in the hotel. It wasn't great and also very very pricey. For example I had a chicken burger and chips, which was about €16 or 18 and the chips were so soggy and awful I didn't eat them. The burger was passable. Also the water in the room service bar was very expensive. There is a lovely bar and lounge area but again the drinks are pricey. I loved the hotel, just watch the prices.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: cindyEngland
Reviews.Content: The location of this Hotel is quite good, its about a half hour stroll into the main streets of Madrid, walking through the best areas of the City, I felt very safe. Mostly people are friendly, although the Hotel staff were outstanding, they just could not do enough for us during our stay. The Hotel itself is beautiful especially at night, just before Christmas it was truly magical, all lit up. Our Hotel room was spacious and very clean. No pretty views as its a city, but our room window was a long way away from overlooking anyone. The food was good, and there is a lovely lounge area to sit and recover from the City bustle. I would definately stay at this Hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice”
Reviews.Author: FastTrackDxB
Reviews.Content: Stayed two nights in June 2008. Nice hotel, great staff. The hotel is a bit dated, but has the old European charm. In an upscale neighborhood, away from city center but close to subway station. Great cafes nearby for breakfast. Did a few tours thru the hotel, highly recommended. The room was spacious, nicely appointed, bathrobes, slippers, water, etc. Free internet at business center, though a bunch of kids were there almost all the time. Room service was a bit challenging as the people taking orders didn't speak much English. Ordered breakfast one morning, was a bit disappointing, old pasteries, old fruit, cold coffee. Overall, liked the hotel would go back again if the price is lower.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: taisteal09
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Hotel Wellington in late December 2008 and to celebrate the New Year in Madrid. We booked the hotel on the Aer Lingus website. Overall, we were disappointed with the service as follows: - The male staff in the hotel did not present a friendly face to guests and should be made aware of who pays the bills. It would be expected that a hotel of this quality would have staff with limited English or more importantly, a willingness to try to understand basic English. This was not our experience. - We had no control over the room temperature -- it was uncomfortably hot and stuffy. We would not recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: dopus
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Wellington hotel and we loved it. The hotel room was spacious,clean and neat. The bathroom was big and extremely clean and the shower luxurious.The plaster between the tiles around the bath could use some change.I liked the glas door dividing the toilet and the bathroom.The bed was huge and comfortable. The walls are a bit thin,we heard some action on the next room as well as the flushing of the toilets and people using the shower.Our room on the 5 fth floor was above a nightclub but we only noticed once because we had our window open.Once we close the window we didn't hear anything. The staf was great .They were helpfull and friendly.When we arrived our room was next to the elevator,when we complained about the constant noise they gave us a room right away. The lady from housekeeping was very nice.The hotel is on a great location and the metro is very near.We can't wait to go back to madrid and stay in the Wellington again.

Reviews.Title: “Top-end luxury at a reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: EuroJapanFamily
Reviews.Content: My family and I had a wonderful stay (2 nights) at this hotel. The staff was friendly and efficient. We were traveling with a 1 year-old baby and there was always some smiling employee rushing to carry the stroller down the stairs or to help in any way. The breakfast buffet was excellent with a large choice of both spanish and international dishes and freshly squeezed juices. The room (junior suite) was immaculate, quiet and had a nice view over the Madrid skyline. The bed was one of the most comfortable I ever slept in. The building is old, charming and perfectly located in the posh Barrio Salamanca area. Although I saw some readers complaining about the size of the elevators I think they were okay. Elevators in century-old european buildings are usually not very large and these ones were among acceptable standards. We booked through the hotel's website and had a special discount fare, as August seems to be the low season there, which made our stay increadibly cheap for such a high level of luxury. I would recommend this hotel to anyone staying in Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury stay in the Spannish capital comes top choice!”
Reviews.Author: SophieCalifornia
Reviews.Content: The five star luxury Wellington hotel is said to be one of the top three hotels in Madrid and I can't deny that. The Ritz and the Westin are the other luxury five star hotels, but they do not have the outdoor swimming pool privilege that there is at The Wellington. I was lucky to stay in July and the weather was very typical hot, so having the pool area was fantastic and the food here is very good. The room I had was a standard king size bed room and was spacious and the marble bathroom was really big and complimentary toiletries are amongst the best quality, although Molton Brown products are only available in the suites, I still managed to blag some of the body lotions! Watch out for wanting to put your own food and drinks in the mini bar fridge to keep cool, because it is an electronic computerised fridge and anything moved is automatically charged to your bill even if you haven't consumed it. I had to complain and have the drinks removed to keep my own food cold, because I refuse to pay 3 Euros for a Coke, etc. Usually the staff are not this easy going and guests are warned that this is not allowed, so next time if I stay here I will call the hotel beforehand to get a mini fridge arranged. I never had the breakfast, but it is an expensive extra at around 25 Euros. Try the supermarket across the road from the hotel instead! Or there are plenty of lovely cafes and restaurants around the area which are cheaper and very good. The hotel is located in the trendy Salamanca neighbourhood of Madrid, where there are a lot of really good boutiques and the famous El Corte Ingles department store is ten minutes walk. It is also walking distance from the Palacio De Deportes concert and sports arena and walking distance from the Metro.

Reviews.Title: “Grand Old Character Hotel”
Reviews.Author: StarbucksTina
Reviews.Content: We stayed 8 nights at this beautifully appointed hotel In June/July 2008, combining a pleasure trip with a business commitment. The staff was very courteous, helpful and fluent in English. They were always able to steer us towards points of interest, shoe stores (very important for one of us) and arranged for us to see an English speaking dentist (one of us popped a crown). A real test of how really good the staff is! For convenience, we frequently had breakfast right at the hotel. Not cheap, but a very comprehensive buffet with excellent food. The hotel is very well located for shopping, strolling, transportation. It is right on a main street, but amazingly quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, well located”
Reviews.Author: Lyds76
Reviews.Content: It's always difficult to judge a place when you haven't necessarily tried the competition. The hotel was fine, did not necessarily have huge amounts of character but this is a matter of personal taste i guess. However it is really well placed, we walked back in the middle of the night and felt totally safe. It's about a 15 mins walk to puerta del sol. Our room looked like it had been freshly painted, it was clean, and we haven't had problems with noise at all. When i asked at what time we had to check out they said twelve but immediately added that if we wanted to stay until one or one thirty it was no problem at all, i didn't even have to ask. Overall we had a good experience and i'd happily stay at the Wellington again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Much Overrated disappointment”
Reviews.Author: suitcaseIllinois
Reviews.Content: I can't tell whether they claim to be 5 star - or just 4 -depends on the website you choose I guess. I'd give it a 3 regardless. Upon check in I handed the clerk my airline card to receive mileage credits. Although they are affiliated with this airline - because I had a "special promotion rate" -they would not take my card!!! My particular rate is a corportate rate negotiated by my rather large, international corporation & the hotel - so you'd assume I'd be a preferred client - guess not. I asked for a quiet room having just landed from the states - I was put in a small room - off the elevator lobby rather than down a hall - oh well - I chose not to make an issue out of it. The room was very clean. I was only in town 2 nights - I ate dinner at the hotel restaurant one of them - what a mistake. The service was very slow (OK - it's Spain -so you get use to it) BUT I had to send my food back twice to get it cooked well - which is what I ordered the first time. Prices are way too high for the quality -then they would not let us sign the bill to our rooms - "it's not allowed" we were told. 5 stars huh? Overall its old, stuffy & arrogant - its off my list and should never be on yours - there are many good places in Madrid - better food, better rooms , better attitude - take this one off your list.

Reviews.Title: “Wellington Bootiful”
Reviews.Author: andih
Reviews.Content: Having stayed in Madrid before I wanted to try somewhere different, but still close to the places I love: The Retiro Park, Salamanca and The Prado. The Wellington fitted the bill and it was the perfect place for a weekend away with my best friend. It's in a great location, walkable to all the cultural spots and close to Calle Serrano and Calle Goya for shopping, in the more upmarket area of the city. The hotel itself is a traditional style with plush furnishings and chandeliers - not everyone's taste - but absolutely beautiful. Good size rooms with a dressing room (as well as a wardrobe) and double basins in the bathrooms - perfect for two women that travel with a lot of toiletries! Staff were very helpful and the concierge team gave us good recommendations for restaurants and flamenco. The bar is also a good place to start or finish your evenings. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Love the Wellington!”
Reviews.Author: PeripateticGirl70
Reviews.Content: This is my third time the the Wellington, and once again, I was not disappointed. The hotel has excellent staff, is clean, comfortable, great food for room service, located within a 15 minute walk to museums. The subway is close by and easy to take. There is a great little take away a few blocks away called Mallorca's (ask reception where, can't remember the street). The hotel is in a safe part of town, is next to Retiro park. Reception speaks English. I just love this hotel and look forward to staying there every time I am in Madrid and am sorry to leave.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant, Useful, Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: RodRodrigo
Reviews.Content: A well located, small, classic hotel offering all the comfort and convenience for the business traveller. Rooms are run of the mill but well appointed with good room service and mini bar. Bathrooms are well serviced. The room in general seemed a littel dated with little gems of modernity (bath/shower taps, flat screen TV and interactive entertainment system) accentuating an otherwise well maintained yet old fittings. (peach bath, carpets, marble bathroom finish!). Breakfast buffet was 'compact'. Staff were typical of any city hotel. Would stay again and perfect for business one/two nighters but lacks the 'wow' factor for an amazing holiday or weekend break.

Reviews.Title: “Wellington wasn't bad, but would choose somewhere else next time”
Reviews.Author: cr0d
Reviews.Content: The Wellington is a beautiful building, and the interior, communal areas are extremely well appointed. I see that the hotel is now billed as a 4-star hotel, which is about right - when i visited it was touted as 5-star, and was definitely not of this class. Rooms were ok, with very nice bathrooms, but we were annoyingly (like in many mainland European hotels) given a twin bed instead of a double. We asked to change and the staff member we spoke to promised to arrange this. Despite this, during our 4 day stay no-one once made an effort to find a new room. Location is excellent - walking distance to galleries and Retiro Park, with excellent restaurants and shopping nearby.

Reviews.Title: “All in all a very pleasant hotel”
Reviews.Author: WorldWideTraveller1
Reviews.Content: Hotel Wellington is a charming hotel in traditonal style conveniently located in the city centre of Madrid close to Retiro Park. Metro stations Vélazquez and Retiro are only 3 minutes walking distance away. Our room on the fifth floor on the courtyard side was quiet, spacious and had an extraordinary large marble bathroom, suitable to a traditional old Grand Hotel. The buffet breakfast was extensive, tasty and well presented on the buffet. The only bad experience after a pleasant stay of one week at the Hotel Wellington was having afternoon tea in the lobby at the day we left. They brought us a pot of hot water with a selection of several tea bags. Because we had used four tea bags in the end they charged us the price of four teas, all together a price of 20,80 € (which is about 30,- $!), which is the highest price for a tea bag tea, I ever had to pay in my life. A real rip off! So our good opinion about the Hotel Wellington (without this experience we had rated it with 5 points) was spoiled at the end and we left the hotel in a very bad mood. But altogether I can say: if you stay away from the lobby and don´t drink drinks from the mini bar, which are also exremely expensive, your stay at the Wellington can be quite enjoyable and worth the money you spend.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, comfortable and elegant”
Reviews.Author: Ricard G
Reviews.Content: One of the best hotels in Madrid, traditional and classical in style. The room I stayed in was quite small (it was their most basic room, admittedly) but it was clean, quiet and very comfortable. Great bathroom and shower. Very good breakfast (though not the best in Madrid, which is either the Ritz or the Palace). Overall highly recommendable. Oh, and the hotel restaurant, the Goizeko Wellington, is truly fabulous.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and nice location.”
Reviews.Author: hoops48821
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for pleasure on the way back from a business trip to India. My wife flew over to meet me for a 3 day weekend (We live in Ohio). This was a beautiful hotel. Everyone was very friendly. It is very close (2 blocks) from the Parque del Retiro which is a wonderful place to jog. My wife and I spent several hours wondering the park on Dec 9 when it was about 60F. The park was packed with people enjoying the beautiful day. This hotel is in a great neighborhood. I would definitely return. We loved Madrid and I hope to return.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive but good experienc”
Reviews.Author: Traveler_USA1
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in the Wellington hotel on December 6-8 2007 we are 4 adults and 2 kids. Facilities: The hotel is very clean and the rooms are very spacious, as we added two extra beds for our kids- though not all the rooms are the same size. Cleaning ladies come twice a day. Kids stay free under curtain age. Location: The location was very close to the center of Madrid (Alcala and Gan Via streets). Food: Did not dine at the hotel but at the Zen Chinese restaurant near by (approx 8 minutes walk) which was very good and not too expensive - Open for lunch 13:45-16:30; Dinner 20:45- midnight). In Spain the coffee is not up-to-par if you expect the high quality coffee of Italy... We booked the hotel online, and mentioned we need 2 extra beds. Upon check-in we were told that because the hotel was fully booked with families as it was a holiday, they had only 1 bed. After insisting on an extra bed in GOOD manner ( I guess I believe in smiling rather then shouting) we got the extra bed. Overhaul it was a good experience but it was expected to be that way as we paid 160 Euro each night... for a 4-5 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: NMJ6
Reviews.Content: This was the perfect place for a great holiday. The location was convenient, close to main museums and so brilliant for the Retiro where we spend brilliant moments ,the rowing experience on the lake was amusing. The hotel atmosphere is relaxing.Every little detail thought through carefully to make the custumer fell at ease and stress free.The facilites are great and the service impecable. The staff are welcoming and professional.The buffet breakfast is first class and a great way to sart the day.We will definitely stay there again next time we visit Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location But...”
Reviews.Author: TravellerGeorgetown
Reviews.Content: The location next to the park is great. The buffet breakfast had a great selection. The room was spacious but be sure to stay away from the 1st floor rooms if the disco is open below. You will not be able to sleep. I would stay again but in another (quieter) room.

Reviews.Title: “Great area to stay”
Reviews.Author: Pilatesperson
Reviews.Content: The Wellington is in a v good area for the museums and Retiro park, and it is only a 30min walk to the train station (day trip to Toledo is easily done). There are some nice places to eat nearby. We checked in late and the concierge directed to a tapas bar nearby called 5 Jotas. Our waitress was great and v helpful. We had a lovely meal and rolled home at 2am! Staff in the hotel were generally helpful although some seemed grumpy/stressed out. The rooms were large enough but decor needed freshened up. Bedlinen and towels were changed daily which I thought was excessive. I like to be given the chance to be eco-friendly and not contribute to the laundry as often. The buffet breakfasts were great. Lots of delicious food to enjoy. I would've given this place a 4/5 except that there was a mistake on their part (they gave us a double instead of a twin room). They said they'd sort it that night, didn't, so we had to get it sorted in the morning. No apology. Nothing, not even complimentary drinks. Not impressed. By the way, don't even open the minibar or they'll try to charge you for it. We put in our own bottles of water to chill overnight and they tried to charge us 27 Euros for it! Luckily, after some strong words they backed down. That's a 2/5 for poor customer relations. Wellington is good if you are paying 3* price for a 5*hotel as we did.

Reviews.Title: “A very useful hotel”
Reviews.Author: FoxleyWiltshire
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from spending 3 days and nights at the Wellington. We found the staff at the desk most helpful. When I could not find my way to the swimming pool I was escorted by a very pleasant employee of the hotel. Lovely pool, padded sun beds, towels, jacuzzi, changing rooms. Large bathroom and average size room which was very clean. Modern television, lots of wardrobes, bed linen was changed daily as were towels. An excellent breakfast, I asked for an omlette each morning and one arrived at my place very quickly. Everyone was very polite and pleasant. Food and drinks are a bit pricey but the surroundings make up for it. The tour bus stops outside the door but be warned it will not stop if full! We were able to check in at 10am which was a bonus. We really enjoyed our stay at this hotel and would recommend it to all!!

Reviews.Title: “Elegant. Good value.”
Reviews.Author: bigshraga
Reviews.Content: Elegant. Neighborhood compares to Upper East Side of New York City. Ate breakfast on our balcony. Tons of red marble in bathroom. Vestibule door added to privacy, sound-proofing.

Reviews.Title: “An old world hotel ideally situated and competitively priced.”
Reviews.Author: Samadi
Reviews.Content: Just came back last week from my second visit to Madrid. After having stayed at the 4 star Vinci Soho a couple of months ago and hated it, decided to go with a 5 star establishment that was priced the SAME!!! Well, there’s a huge difference between the Soho and the Wellington, even if there’s no difference in price!! Firstly from the hotel location, again a fantastic spot to be in, most important shopping streets just a short walk away, great restaurants (try Iroco a few steps from the hotel and Thai Garden, another excellent restaurant a short walk down Calle de Villanueva) as well as the Prado and Retiro park is right there at your doorstep. In terms of the pros for this hotel: 1.Great location 2.Spacious 3.Underground parking in the hotel 4.Rooms are big by European standards, medium size by US standards. I think we had what they call an Executive room, but it was surprisingly large, with high ceilings, faced inwards, and had a small entrance area and a seating area. As for closet space, I haven’t seen a hotel room in such a type of hotel before that had as many as this! No less than 3 full size double door closets, with drawers and plenty of hangers. 5.Nice size LCD TV with several English channels as well as on demand movies. 6.24hr Room service that was super efficient and VERY fast (longest wait I had was 17 minutes). 7.NO NOISE! Can’t stress this one enough. The rooms are super quite. So if you want a quiet sleep, this is great (though beds as usual in Europe seem to be lacking comfort) 8.Large bathroom (though not exactly best designed for efficient use of space). Still wonderful to have a very powerful shower (no water saving flow control here), double sinks, plenty of robes, towels and a host of amenities provided daily. As for the cons; 1.Room service and mini bar prices excessive!! 2.There’s a lounge area downstairs, usually typical place to have an afternoon tea. This hotel hasn’t got a clue what ‘Afternoon Tea’ means. Ordered Afternoon Tea and got a piece of cake and a tea pot???? Went to the Ritz instead. 3.Despite the hotel having been refurbished, room décor was dated and dull. But at the end of the day, I only want to sleep in the room not live in it, so it didn’t bother me much. 4.Small elevators…but again, typical of European hotels. 5.INEFFECIENT elevators, you can wait for 5+ minutes to see an elevator come to your floor and then you better hope it doesn’t have 4 people in it because that’s the maximum it can take, or 2 people with 2 pieces of luggage. 6.The dreaded Kubi WiFi at 17 euros a day! At the end of the day, the hotel served its purpose; it gave me a place to stay, with a great location and peace and quiet at night. The hotel isn’t the Ritz or the Palace, so don’t compare this one to 5 star establishments like those. But at the price for this place, it’s more than half the cost and even cheaper than some of the 4 star hotels in town. The hotel obviously is well known in town, as in my 5 days staying there, there were several days where paparazzi and camera crews were camped out right on the entrance doorstep.

Reviews.Title: “Wellington Madrid: What I've come to expect of European 5 star hotels”
Reviews.Author: TheTravelingTaxman
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Wellington from Feb 14-18 2007 as part of a meeting with a couple days of vacation thrown in. This hotel reminded me a lot of the Grand Hotel de la Minerve in Rome or the Cour des Loges in Lyon where I have also had the chance to stay. This is good and bad... The good: Location is absolutely great, close to the Prado and the other museums, good restaurants, shopping and nightlife within walking distance and the MadridVision bus is indeed a nice bonus. The room was clean, with loads of closet space; the Wi-Fi worked well. The bad: As a North American, I just can't get used to the two single beds stuck together instead of one queen! Also, the room is small by our standards, though bigger than the other two I mentioned above. The bathroom was clean and the two sinks was nice, but it needs an update. All in all, if I was paying 150-200$ a night, I would have thought it was great. As it were, for 205EUROS a night, so more than 300 of my lowly Canadian dollars, I thought it was quite expensive and not a great bang for your buck. As an added frustration, the bar prices are truly out of control, at 5,90Euros for a measly Diet Coke.... All in all, expensive but at least nice. I would guess Europeans would find it more to the norm than North Americans. That being said, Madrid is a really nice city, worth seeing. We also spent two days in Santa Maria de El Paular in the north mountains, which were awesome.

Reviews.Title: “The Wellington Hotel is very comfortable.”
Reviews.Author: Reports
Reviews.Content: A girlfriend and I booked the Wellington for four nights. We were very pleased with our accommodation and the service provided. We had a large room with very comfortable beds and our sheets (monogrammed) were changed everyday. Our bathroom was spacious and well appointed with robes and toiletries. We really enjoyed our breakfasts and the staff were most attentive. We would disagree with two of the recent reporters. The staff were most solicitous and breakfast was excellent with a wide choice of food including whole smoked salmon and a ham, and one could eat as much as one liked. There was Spanish Champagne and wine too included in the breakgast. The hotel is well placed for the Prado, the Thyssen and the centre of town, and the Reitro park is within a two minute walk, as is the underground. We also found the Wellington reasonably quiet at night. This could not be said about all the hotels in Madrid! It also felt reasonably safe to walk in the immediate area. We were also well placed for the main shopping seats in the Serrano area. The hotel is slightly old fashioned, but in the nicest possible way. This is not a hotel for jeans and trainers, or those wanting designer minimalism. Some of the furnishings are rather dated, and our shower needed to be replaced as it was static, and not what is expected in a 5* hotel, however we were very comfortable and happy with the surroundings. The foyer and lounges were comfortable and there was a pianist in the evenings. Certainly we would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Not quite what was expected”
Reviews.Author: jimbells
Reviews.Content: I had read amazing reviews about this hotel. However we had an executive room and were disappointed with its size and tiredness of fittings. It is a nice hotel and very conveniently placed for Retiro Park, shopping and supermarkets. The tourist bus stops outside. BEWARE - whilst you can get on early in the morning, in peak season you can stand waiting as bus after bus goes by full with tourists. Tempers get very frayed because the fare is not cheap. Use the Metro instead. When we were there there were two bus loads of Japanese staying. There are only two lifts holding four persons in each lift - you can wait a very long time because the lifts are not synchronised and skip your floor if the first call is from another floor. Very annoying for the less mobile. Very friendly staff and excellent, but expensive food. A small fruit juice costs over six euros. Not far away is an Irish Pub doing excellent food after20.00hrs. 12 euros gets you food and a pint of Guinness. Taxi fares from the airport seem to have increased significantly. 21 euros on a quick run. In traffic can get to 30 euros. Metro station is only 5 min walk from hotel.

Reviews.Title: “911 25th Anniversary”
Reviews.Author: brucehannay
Reviews.Content: We have a "big trip" planned over Xmas/New Year to celebrate our Silver Wedding Anniversary but couldn't let the day pass without doing something a wee bit special. Somewhere close to the UK, somewhere a bit elegant and accommodation to live it up a bit. After much deliberation from reading various reviews of Madrid hotels, plumped for the Wellington and very glad we did. As has previously been stated it is located in a very upmarket area of Madrid. Ideally situated for a visit to Retiro Park - literally 2 minutes from the door. We took a walk there on Sunday afternoon and I'm guessing this is the place that families and tourists go for a relaxing time judging by the number of people there. A lovely parkland oasis in the centre of such a bustling city. Full of outdoor cafes, street entertainers, market stalls and a large boating lake. The Hotel itself is what I would describe as 'very olde worlde'. A throw back to the days when service and charm were available to those who could afford it. Nowadays of course these attributes are much easier to come by through competition from other hotels but the Wellington has lost none of what it takes to make your stay both enjoyable and comfortable. Rooms are an ideal size with large comfy beds. The bathroom is almost the same size as the room itself ! Shower/bath; super power in the shower; dual wash basins; large mirror; double unit toilet; and the largest array of complmentary toiletries I have seen. We had breakfast included and took advantage of the service on both mornings. Great spread of food from just basic toast, marmalade & coffee, if it suits, down to the 'full experience' with a Full Scottish; smoked salmon and ham; AND the nice touch we had on the morning of our anniversary - the Head waiter opened the bottle of cava that sat on ice for us to set the day of as we wanted it to continue, proving it wasn't merely there for display purposes. Yes - the in-hotel menu for drinks and snacks is a bit expensive but it is served with discretion and sitting in the opulent seating area with it's chandelier surroundings - what the heck !! Another plus point for us, as it turned out, was the vicinity of the MadridVision Tour Bus Stop. I had calculated we may have a few minutes walk to the nearest one. Not at all !! Stop number 14 on the Red Route is literally on the Hotel doorstep - a bonus - as it was our intended way round the city for the couple of days we were there. It runs until midnight so you know you can get back to base having paid up front. That said we did make one taxi journey which was swift and reasonably priced. BTW - taxi fare from airport to Hotel - 25 - 30 Euros. All in all a lovely place to stay for a short break. Would highly recommend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxed and upmarket”
Reviews.Author: SunSeaSandGirl
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Wellington for a short break in September with a friend, and it was perfect. Great location with fabulous shops all around and its only a short walk or a really short metro ride away from the city centre. The hotel also has a pool which was great. Our room was generously sized and very comfortable and the bathroom was enormous. The staff were really friendly and helpful also. The only draw back was the prices of everything sold at the hotel, I accept that it is a five star hotel so things will be at a premium but I still think charging 5 euros for a bottle of water and 9 euros for two cups of tea is taking the mickey.

Reviews.Title: “Not Bad, Not Great Either”
Reviews.Author: vic2171
Reviews.Content: The Wellington is an OK typical European hotel. The lobby and hallways are quite nice. We had booked the hotel at least a month ahead and had emailed asking for a room with one double bed. Upon check in, we were told that only rooms with two double beds were available. How hard would it have been to get us a room with one bed since we had made the request so far in advance... THe room itself was not impressive at all. The beds were hard as rocks and the bedding felt very cheap-kind of like polyester. The furnishings in the room could definitely use an update and there was water damage on the ceiling of our room. The bathroom is the nicest part of the room although the shower is so strong it floods the bathroom unless you position it just so. The hotel is located is Salamanca, a lovely upscale neighborhood-with great stores and restaurants. Iroco, just down the street from the hotel is a great restaurant. We absolutely loved Madrid-the hotel was just OK.

Reviews.Title: “Feb 10-12th - Perfect spot to start your city tour”
Reviews.Author: Inabobina
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Wellington this past weekend and were totally happy with the room and the hotel. The breakfast is terrific. The area around the hotel is very nice and safe, one of the best regions in the city. The "Retiro-Park" is located right around the corner and you can reach the historic city centre by food within 20 min. The Metro Station is right around the block and even if you take the cab to the airport, it is only 15 Euros! Even if it is more expensive than other hotels, it is worth it! We had a great weekend!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and nice safe area”
Reviews.Author: Ashrodog
Reviews.Content: If you need a clean, well appointed hotel in a nice shopping/dining area then stay here. It was in a safe, clean residential area and I found it to be close to most everything. I would stay there again. I also found it to be a great value.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Madtown79
Reviews.Content: I'm surprised at the other reviews of the Wellington, especially regarding the "disappointing" rooms - I had the exact opposite experience. I stayed here in September, 2004, and everything was fantastic. The room was gorgeous (large and quiet; deliciously comfortable beds; beautiful furniture; heavy drapes; double-glazed windows), the bathroom huge and spotless, and the service outstanding. There were chocolates on our pillows every evening, heavy terry cloth robes in the bathroom, and lots of sweet little sample toiletries - including a shaving kit and mouthwash. The (free) breakfast is served in a large, pleasant room and includes delicious cheeses, hams, breads, and pastries, as well as cereals, fruits, eggs, and other traditional dishes. The staff was pleasant and helpful, and the location extremely convenient. I loved Madrid, and a big part of that was my amazing stay at the Wellington. I would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “I would return”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The room was sized like a typical European room, very small, but clean and neat. However, the bathroom was large and beautiful. I found the location to be excellent, I could walk in the morning in the park, in the evening you are steps away from the high shopping area with nice cafes and restaurants. A 20 Euro cab ride from the airport. I did not eat in the hotel, but used sidewalk cafes nearby. I would go back, but not until I have explored other local hotels in Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “I don't understand why this is considered 5 Star”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I took a short trip into Madrid and decided to stay at the Wellington Hotel. I read that the location was good and the amenities were impeccable. Well, this was the absolute furthest thing from the truth! When I checked in, the staff was very friendly. My fiancee and I received our room key right away, and we were off to our 5th floor closet-sized room which had a not-so-intriguing view of a building. The room was terrible! It was cramped...hardly big enough for 1 person, the beds were tiny (we got stuck with two twin-sized beds) and hard as rocks, and the location of the room was horrific. The best part of the room was the marble bathroom (which the hotel brags about...seems like this is the only feature worth having)...but I wasn't going to spend my entire stay sitting on the toilet. In addition to the terrible room, the breakfast buffet is something that is not even worth the time. One pays about 20 euro a day for the buffet...and there is nothing that you can't get there that is readily available at the Dunkin Donuts down the street. I would be extremely careful about going to this hotel. For the good location it does offer, the price is certainly not worth it. I don't even understand how a hotel like this can be considered a 5-star hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stunning hotel and extremely clean, everything you would expect from a 5 star hotel. Did find eating / drinking in hotel quite expensive and found using their cafe next door was more reasonable. Did find the restaurant manager alittle miserable which made me and my partner feel uncomfortable. Apart from that great, the location was perfect also.

Reviews.Title: “Tiny Room, Impersonal staff”
Reviews.Author: redsushi
Reviews.Content: We traveled throughout Spain in June-July 2004 by personal car. I am fluent in Spanish. We stayed in 11 hotels. Our travel agent booked the Wellington--business rate for 3 days. We read the Trip-Advisor reviews and expected a wonderful experience. This hotel was unquestionably the worst place we stayed while in Spain. The room was tiny for the three of us. We had an extra bed and instantly the room became wall-to-wall bed. The bathroom, according to our daughter, was "airplane size": one could not open the door and have someone at the sink simultaneously. The hotel location is good IF you hop on the metro (which is close). Don't expect to walk to the Puerta del Sol (it's far, even for Spaniards). Do not expect a smile or directions from the indifferent management. They gave us a map and gestured towards the door when we asked for specifics like "where is the metro?". Not worth any discount. If you end up here, the key to a great time is to stay AWAY from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Pleased with wellington”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After reading previous reviews I was somewhat concerned with my choice of this hotel. It actually was very nice. The lobby and the floors are nicely decorated and the service was above average. They spoke very little english, but it didn't seem to be that much of a problem. The room was fairly large, as was the bed. The bathroom was modern, well lit, and spacious. (which I'm very particular about). The hotel is in a good area and not far from the major sights. I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel and a classy location”
Reviews.Author: fivestars

Reviews.Title: “Not quite a 5 star experience”
Reviews.Author: R0ckh0lm
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Hotel Wellington in May. Although meant to be a 5 star, I would regard it only as an average 4 star. Our room was nicely furnished but very very small, although meant to be a superior room. Reception staff not particularly friendly, and less so when we asked for a bigger room if possible (none available for any of the 4 days of our stay apparently). Reception staff remained barely polite and not particularly helpful for the remainder of the trip. On the plus side the location is good - right beside Retiro Park and a short trip from the city centre. The price we paid was ok, but not still not worth it. Better off paying less for somewhere else that is better value, or more for the Palace or Ritz I would think.
